storyArc.title: Young Wolves
storyArc.description:
# Young Wolves
In June 3057, tension between the Wolf and Jade Falcon clans led to the outbreak of the Refusal War. Khan Elias Crichell of Clan Jade Falcon fought the war to destroy his most powerful rival to power. IlKhan Ulric Kerensky fought the war to weaken the fighting capability of the Crusader movement and thus delay the resumption of the drive to Terra. Far more than just a simple Trial of Refusal, the Refusal War at some point involved virtually the entire Touman of both clans and would lead directly or indirectly to the death of four Khans and the death, rebirth and sundering of one clan. The war's implications would ripple out far from the original belligerents to effect the balance of power in the Inner Sphere for a generation.
This is the story of a Trinary of young Wolf warriors eager to write their own line in the Remembrance through glory and sacrifice. The Refusal War will test their resolve, skill, and, most importantly, their loyalty.
## Details
This story arc will take the user through the Clan Refusal War as a Wolf Star Captain. Most battles will involve between a trinary and a star of units, although there will also be several possibilities for individual duels. All combat will be mek only. Two main story endings are possible, depending on player choices.
## Credits
*Author:* Aaron Gullickson (Taharqa)
*Art Credits:*
- PhearTheHam - Florian "SpOoKy777" Mellies - Anthony Scroggins
This story arc is inspired by the Battletech novels *Bred for War* and *Malicious Intent* by Michael Stackpole, as well as the *The Falcon and the Wolf Battletech Scenario Pack* by Rodney Knox. The arc is generally consistent with official Battletech history, but some deviations have been made for narrative purposes.

storyPoint.name: welcome
storyPoint.title: Young Wolves Story Arc
storyPoint.narrative:
In this story arc, you will lead a trinary of Wolf MekWarriors into battle during the Refusal War. Momentarily you will create a character, but first I want to discuss some technical issues.
You will start on an existing campaign file with campaign options already set. You are welcome to adjust many of those campaign settings to your own preferences, but you should keep in mind the following for the best experience:
* You should have no access to additional units, parts, or personnel throughout the campaign, aside from what is already stored in your warehouse and what you can salvage on the battlefield. The settings are designed to reflect this fact. * You should not earn money during the campaign. You are clan, you have no use of it. * You should not take in prisoners and bondsmen during the campaign, except for possible narrative exceptions. * You can set MegaMek options as you like, but should consider two special cases: * Blind play is integral to many of the scenarios and should not be adjusted. By default, the bot will "cheat" and ignore double-blind. This prevents the bot from stalling out in the deployment zone. You can turn this "single-blind" feature off in the game options if you prefer. * Clan physical attacks are disabled for both you and your opponents. You can turn them on if you would prefer grittier and less honorable fights. * Scenario objectives will in most cases be automatically determined, but you may have to check custom objectives during scenario resolution in a few cases. * In the scenario description, pay attention to the *hegira* conditions. These dictate whether you can surrender to your opponents via a `defeat` command and if/when they will surrender to you allowing you to declare victory with a `victory` command. Also pay attention to the rules there about when you can claim a battlefield and thus salvage.
That's it. I hope you enjoy the campaign!

storyPoint.name: create_main_char
storyPoint.instructions: Use this form to create a Clan Wolf MekWarrior, using an XP pool to buy skills and special abilities. Leftover XP will be added to your character. Only Gunnery, Piloting, and Tactics (initiative) will have in-game effects in the story arc.

storyPoint.name: narr_main_char_killed
storyPoint.title: The Story Ends Here
storyPoint.narrative:
Unfortunately, your life has come to an end. With the end of your life comes the end of *this* story, but the story of the Wolves and the Jade Falcons will endure. May your actions earn you a rightful place in the Remembrance.
Seyla.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_killed
storyPoint.title: Khan Ward has Fallen
storyPoint.narrative: Khan Phelan Ward has fallen in battle. The remaining Wolf forces are in disarray, and it is only a matter of time before they are overwhelmed by the Jade Falcons. The story ends here.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_killed
storyPoint.title: Khan Ulric has Fallen
storyPoint.narrative: Khan Ulric Kerensky has fallen in battle. You fight bravely on as you are swarmed by Jade Falcon meks from all sides. Eventually you succumb to the onslaught. The story ends here.

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_game_over
storyPoint.title: End of Your Story
storyPoint.narrative: As you attempt to extricate yourself from the cockpit of your downed mek, you hear the footfall of Mathius's mek approach. You know there will be no mercy. This fight was always to the death. As the laser beams begin to atomize your body, you close your eyes, taking some small comfort that Clan Wolf will live on in some form or another and that you have done all that could be expected of you as a warrior. This is the end of your story.

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_chistu_death
storyPoint.title: End of Your Story
storyPoint.narrative:
*Your mek lies sprawled on the ground, nothing but salvage. You hear the footfalls of Chistu's mek as he approaches.*
It would have been better if you had died when you were supposed to, {commanderRank}. No matter, I will rectify that now.
*A blast of searing energy is the last thing you remember, as you are burned to atoms. Your story ends here.*

storyPoint.name: narr_game_end
storyPoint.title: This Journey is Over; Another Begins?
storyPoint.narrative:
You have reached the end of the Young Wolves story arc. Thanks for playing! I hope you enjoyed it.
You may continue playing with this campaign as you wish. Or you can start again with another campaign and see what other possibilities exist within the story arc.

storyPoint.name: wait_devin_start
storyPoint.title: Wait in orbit around Devin for further orders

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_interlude1
storyPoint.title: Repair and rearm while awaiting further orders

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_interlude2
storyPoint.title: Pass time while you travel with Phelan to Broken Hope

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_interlude_bloodname
storyPoint.title: Wait while Trial of Bloodright is organized

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_trial_bloodname1
storyPoint.title: Wait for the next round of competition

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_trial_bloodname2
storyPoint.title: Wait for the next round of competition

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_trial_bloodname3
storyPoint.title: Wait for the next round of competition

storyPoint.name: wait_morges_trial_bloodname4
storyPoint.title: Wait for the next round of competition

storyPoint.name: choice_natasha_greet
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.question:
*The holovid display in your quarters aboard the dropship orbiting Colmar crackles to life.*
Greetings, {commander}. Welcome to Colmar, first of the tombs in which we will bury the Jade Falcons. You have been assigned to my task force for this offensive. Before we get started, let me ask you a simple question. Do you have a problem serving under a Khan older than your geneparents' geneparents and tainted by the Inner Sphere?
storyPoint.choice: No, My Khan. I consider it a great honor.
I will do my duty regardless of any personal feelings.
Your khanship is a farce.

storyPoint.name: choice_natasha_heritage
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.question: You are clearly a formidable warrior as well as a competent commander, {commanderRank}. Yet, you possess no bloodname. Why is this?
storyPoint.choice: I have entered five bloodname trials, but I have never earned the final prize.
I was severely wounded at Tukayyid and my recovery took a long time, preventing me from participating in any trials.
Honors and awards are for the needy. I prove my worth on the battlefield.

storyPoint.name: choice_natasha_heritage
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.question: To which bloodname house do you belong?
storyPoint.choice: Ward
Radick
Carns
Vickers

storyPoint.name: choice_natasha_twycross
storyPoint.title: Time to Withdraw
storyPoint.question:
The Falcons are not taking the bait. There is no point to allowing them to grind us down in this damn sandstorm. I am ordering all forces back through the Great Gash. Proceed to your designated transports and begin transit to the Butler system where you will meet up with Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky for the final phase of this campaign.
I will remain in the Great Gash to challenge all Falcon commanders to individual combat. If we can't destroy them all, at least we can cut off the head. Give them hell until the end, my wolves!
storyPoint.choice: You cannot sacrifice yourself, my Khan. We need your leadership!
They will sing of you in the Remembrance, my Khan.
It pleases me that you are finally taking the honorable path of a *solahma* warrior.
*Say nothing.*

storyPoint.name: choice_mathius_disgrace
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.question: Did you hear that stravag woman's use of contractions? She is a disgrace to the clan. How dare she call herself a Wolf! She should have died honorably in a solahma unit years ago. Instead, she lives on as a testament to the corruption of the Inner Sphere. If she had not placed a moratorium on trials until after this conflict, I would challenge her to a trial of grievance immediately.
storyPoint.choice: You will respect the Khan in my presence.
Do not be a fool. She would dispatch you without scratching her paint job.
I could not agree more.

storyPoint.name: choice_mathius_trial
storyPoint.title: Trial of Refusal
storyPoint.question:
*As the screen goes dark, you realize that all the warriors of your trinary are gathered around you in a semicircle. Mathius steps forward, seething with rage.*
You would dishonor us by fleeing into the Inner Sphere! I will not follow that Spheroid farce of a Khan to live in exile and Abjurement from the Clans! I demand a Trial of Refusal! *Glancing around, you see some of the warriors nod their heads in agreement, while others watch you attentively. You cannot deny Mathius's demand without a mutiny amongst your troops.*
storyPoint.choice: I relish the chance to finally teach you a lesson in humility.
You will have your trial, and then the remainder of my trinary will join with Khan Ward to protect the Inner Sphere from zealots like yourself.
You will have your trial, although I take no joy in what I must do.

storyPoint.name: choice_mathius_death_mercy
storyPoint.title: Mercy or Death?
storyPoint.question:
*As you approach Mathius's downed mek, you can see him within through the glasteel cockpit. He is not struggling to escape. His voice comes through your comm, thick with contempt and rage.*
Do it! Grant me enough dignity to at least die like a warrior, you warden stravag coward!
storyPoint.choice: As you wish. *Push down on your firing trigger.*
I will do you no such favor today. You will come with me to Morges where you will fight like the warrior you were meant to be.
That would be too generous a fate for you. I leave you here on Butler. The Jade Falcons can do with you as they will.

storyPoint.name: choice_ulric_natasha_view
storyPoint.title: Sad Tidings
storyPoint.question: It is no secret that you had little respect for Khan Kerensky when this conflict began. I ask you now, after fighting with her and witnessing her sacrifice, what do you think of Khan Natasha Kerensky, the Black Widow?
storyPoint.choice: I agree that she died a warrior's death and earned a place in the Remembrance.
She failed in her mission and reaped her reward.

storyPoint.name: choice_ulric_final_battle
storyPoint.title: An Important Decision
storyPoint.question:
My task force departs for Wotan in one hour. There we will teach the Falcons a final lesson, although I do not expect to survive it. The remains of your task force are to join mine for this final battle.
However, perhaps that is not the right path for you and your warriors. As you know, Khan Ward has taken many of our warriors with a Warden view into the Inner Sphere. They will live there in exile, helping to prepare the Spheroids for the end of the Tukayyid Truce.
To live in exile is no easy thing and I would not force you to make such a decision. Yet, I cannot help but feel that you and your young pups have more to give to the cause. So I will give you the choice. Will you come to Wotan with me or will you join Khan Ward in exile?
storyPoint.choice: I choose to fight by your side on Wotan for the honor and glory of Clan Wolf.
I will join Khan Ward and carry on the Warden cause.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_warden
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*As you exit the lift into the hangar bay, Star Commander Tayyiba approaches you, looking concerned.*
{commander}, I was hoping I might have a word with you. I heard about what is happening with Khan Ward's forces. I wanted to ask...
*She seems to be struggling with her question.*
I wanted ... to ... ask you whether you support the Warden cause?
storyPoint.choice: Yes, the Founder sought for us to protect the Inner Sphere.
I do not know. My time in the Inner Sphere has left me conflicted.
No, these Spheroids have done nothing to deserve what they have. We must teach them a better way to live, by the Founder's word.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_tukayyid
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question: Did you serve on Tukayyid, {commanderRank}?
storyPoint.choice: Yes, I served with the Thirteenth Wolf Guards, under then-Star Colonel Natasha Kerensky.
Yes, I fought with the Eleventh Wolf Guards. We received much honor for the capture of Skupo, although we paid a heavy price.
Yes, I served in the Silver Keshik, under SaKhan Garth Radick

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_thirteenth
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*Her eyes widen in surprise.*
You were a member of the Wolf Spiders? So you have served under Natasha Kerensky before?
storyPoint.choice: She led us to victory on Tukayyid. I would follow her to the gates of hell.
She fought like a Spheroid on Tukayyid, without honor.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_family
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.question:
*She looks you in the eye.*
I have never been the same after that. That family does not deserve what our "holy mission" has given them. When I think of things that are worth dying for in battle, I think not of glory or honor, but that family.
storyPoint.choice: That is what being a Warden is all about. We are to protect families like those, not to punish them. That is why Khan Ward has been sent into the Inner Sphere.
This just demonstrates your weakness, to be so easily swayed by the enemy. I expect you to show more backbone in the future.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_farewell
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Farewell
storyPoint.question:
*Tayyiba comes to see you later in your cabin.*
I understand why you made the decision that you made to go to Wotan, {commander}. However, I cannot make the decision to die in futility when I can live to protect what I hold dear. I asked Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky for permission to join our fellow Wolves on Morges, which he has granted. The dropship transporting me to another jumpship will be arriving shortly.
*You now notice the small bag over her shoulder.*
I hope you find what you are looking for on Wotan, {commanderRank}.
storyPoint.choice: I hope you find what you seek as well. Whatever happens may the howl of the Wolves never be silenced.
You are a coward and a disgrace to the ways of the Clans.

storyPoint.name: choice_tayyiba_final
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Question
storyPoint.question:
*As you oversee repairs to your units, Tayyiba approaches you.*
We finally did it then? We won this war. How come it doesn't feel like a win, then?
storyPoint.choice: Because it came at a heavy cost. However, I would pay this cost again, knowing the alternative.
Because we have lost everything and can never return home. That is not really a win in my book.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_batchall
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question:
*The screen flickers to show an older man with a determined expression on his face.* This is Star Captain Tobias Malthus, commander of the Jade Falcon forces guarding facility Alpha-Nova-Bravo 919.
*He pauses as if waiting for you to take the lead.*
storyPoint.choice: I am {commander}. The Wolves of Kerensky have claimed this site for their own. What tame dogs defend it?
I think there has been some mistake. I need to speak with the real commander, not some elderly freebirth pencil pusher.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_honor
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question:
*He smiles and nods his head as you issue the batchall in its proper form, clearly impressed.*
I am Star Captain Tobias Malthus and I defend this facility with a binary of Jade Falcon MekWarriors. What force will you commit to utter destruction against the beak and talon of the Falcon?
storyPoint.choice: I see no reason to honor your solahma forces with a fair fight. I bid my full trinary.
I will meet you in a battle of equals. I bid a binary of my forces.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_insult
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question:
*He is momentarily taken aback by your brazen insult. His eyes narrow as he leans in.*
You would dishonor our ways to issue petty insults? Truly, the Wolves have been corrupted. It remains to me to teach you a lesson in humility.
If you do not wish to take the lead that I granted you as the aggressor, then I shall begin. I am Star Captain Tobias Malthus and I defend this facility with a binary of Jade Falcon MekWarriors. What force will you commit to utter destruction against the beak and talon of the Falcon?
storyPoint.choice: I see no reason to honor your solahma forces with a fair fight. I bid my full trinary.
I will meet you in a battle of equals. I bid a binary of my forces.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_alternate_all
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question: What say you? Will you honor the old ways or have you been tainted by Spheroid "tactics?"
storyPoint.choice: Clearly, you have had too much time to read old dusty books in your dotage. As I said at the outset I will bid my full trinary.
I have no the time for such complex rituals, but I have changed my mind and will honor you with an equal combat. I will meet you on the field with a binary.
I accept your challenge. I will choose nine of my warriors to meet you in single combat.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_alternate_equal
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question: What say you? Will you honor the old ways or have you been tainted by Spheroid "tactics?"
storyPoint.choice: I am becoming annoyed by your addled ideas. I think that I will increase my bid to a full trinary, so that I may put you out of your miserable solahma existence.
I have not the time for such rituals. I will meet you on the field as I originally bid, binary vs. binary.
I accept your challenge. I will choose nine of my warriors to meet you in single combat.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_end_batchall
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.question: So it is, then. Well bargained and done, I will see you on the field of battle.
storyPoint.choice: Well bargained and done.
Whatever, old man.

storyPoint.name: choice_tobias_bondsman
storyPoint.title: A Request
storyPoint.question: Wait, before you leave! You have proved more than my equal on the field of battle, {commanderRank}. I know that the current unfortunate climate between our clans has precluded the exchange of bondsmen, but I would be honored to serve as the bondsman to a noble and unequaled warrior such as yourself. I know that some will say I am past my prime, but I can assure you that I am a fighter to be reckoned with and will serve you with utter loyalty.
storyPoint.choice: We can use all the warriors we can get. I will take you on and cut your bondcord immediately.
Alright, if it will shut you up, I will take you on as a bondsman. However, you will wear the bondcord until I see fit to cut it.
I think its best if you just stay here and stick with the warrior monk bit.

storyPoint.name: choice_trial_location
storyPoint.title: Negotiating the Trial
storyPoint.question:
*You have accepted Star Commander Mathius's challenge and the deck has been cleared of all other occupants while you await the arrival of an official to negotiate the trial. As you eye the still fuming Star Commander, your screen suddenly flickers to life, revealing the worn face of Star Colonel Marco Hall.*
I understand that you have received and accepted a Trial of Refusal from Star Commander Mathius. I will be overseeing this trial.
At the present moment, the logistics of finding a location for such a trial are not easy. However, the Falcons on Butler have agreed to grant safcon if you wish to have this trial on-planet, so long as only two meks leave the ship. Apparently, some traditions are still honored even in the midst of this *dezgra* war.
Since you are the defender, the choice of battlefield is yours, {commander}. Where would you like to meet Star Commander Mathius?
storyPoint.choice: I will meet him on the Thompkins mega-glacier in the polar wastes of the planet.
I will hunt him in the fetid swamps of the equatorial region.
I will watch him die slowly in the unyielding vacuum upon the moon of Valet.
I will fight him on the open plains outside of Newton.

storyPoint.name: choice_trothkin_div_ella
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.question:
You stravag coward! Those that would flee the fight to live among spheroids are honorless dogs and no longer deserve to be called clan. I gladly accept your request for a trial. Let us resolve it here and now and may none interfere while I teach you what it really means to be a Wolf.
*They both turn to you expectantly.*
storyPoint.choice: Enough. We do not have the luxury of these kinds of spats at the moment. Permission for a trial of grievance is denied. Both of you will return to your quarters.
I will allow it. Make a circle of equals and may the best warrior win, as the Founder intended. Seyla!
You may have your trial, but unaugmented. Whatever the outcome, we will have need of both of you in the battles to come.

storyPoint.name: choice_butler_mutiny
storyPoint.title: A Mutiny
storyPoint.question:
Hello {commander}. I am glad to see it is you returning. Unfortunately, we have a bit of a situation here. After hearing the results of the trial, Ella was able to convince a few other warriors that it would be better to die in battle here against the Falcons than to go into exile with Khan Phelan. They were able to exit with their meks before I was aware of the plan.
*As she says this, you begin to hear the sounds of heavy weapons fire in the distance. The Falcons are likely enraged by this perceived violation of the truce. Going after these warriors would be suicide.*
storyPoint.choice: Those damn fools! Their fate is sealed. Prepare for liftoff.
There is no way to rescue them and we best be off before the Falcons come after us for violating their truce.

storyPoint.name: choice_butler_ella_desert
storyPoint.title: Suicidal Desertion
storyPoint.question:
Hello {commander}. I am glad to see it is you returning. Unfortunately, we have a bit of a situation here. After hearing the results of the trial, Ella attempted to convince other warriors that it would be better to die in battle here against the Falcons than to go into exile with Khan Phelan. She was not able to convince anyone else to join her, but she was able to exit with her mek before I was aware of her plans.
*As she says this, you begin to hear the sounds of heavy weapons fire in the distance. The Falcons are likely enraged by this perceived violation of the truce. Going after Ella would be suicide.*
storyPoint.choice: What a damn fool! Her fate is sealed. Prepare for liftoff.
There is no way to rescue her and we best be off before the Falcons come after us for violating their truce.

storyPoint.name: choice_butler_parting_group
storyPoint.title: A Parting of Ways
storyPoint.question: {commander}, a dropship has pulled alongside and has begun transferring some personnel and equipment. Apparently, Felipe and a few other warriors convinced Star Colonel Ulric to let them join the Wolves in Morges. There is not much I can do about it, {commanderRank}, but I thought you should be aware.
storyPoint.choice: Cowards who run from the battle we were bred and born to fight. Let them go with their tails between their legs be leashed by their new Spheroid masters.
We can do nothing. Let them go.

storyPoint.name: choice_butler_parting_solo
storyPoint.title: A Parting of Ways
storyPoint.question: {commander}, a dropship has pulled alongside and has begun transferring some personnel and equipment. Apparently, Felipe convinced Star Colonel Ulric to let him join the Wolves in Morges. He apparently attempted to convince others to join him without success. There is not much I can do about it, {commanderRank}, but I thought you should be aware.
storyPoint.choice: He is a coward who runs from the battle we were bred and born to fight. Let him go with his tail between his legs be leashed by his new Spheroid masters.
We can do nothing. Let him go.

storyPoint.name: choice_phelan_rescue
storyPoint.title: A Grateful Khan
storyPoint.question: {commander}, I am grateful for your unexpected, but fortuitous, arrival. I take it that Ulric sent you our way due to your ... point of view? Or was it just that you couldn't stand Vlad's stink any longer?
storyPoint.choice: It was never really much of a choice for me. The Inner Sphere must be protected from fanatics like the Jade Falcons.
It was not easy, but Natasha and Ulric showed me that this is the only path forward.
I tried to give him some deodorant, but he insisted it was "unclan-like."

storyPoint.name: choice_phelan_broken_hope
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.question:
*Phelan turns to you with a grave expression.*
The Refusal War is over. Clan Wolf will live on.
*He fixes you with a quizzical look.*
What do you think of my actions here today?
storyPoint.choice: War is hell. I do not desire to see other warriors die in such a fashion, but I understand why the decision was made. The Wolves must survive.
It is a dishonor to our ways. These warriors deserved a better death, Falcon or not.
They had it coming.

storyPoint.name: choice_phelan_bloodname
storyPoint.title: Earn a Bloodname
storyPoint.question:
Now that the war is over, we must turn our attention to rebuilding our forces. With the touman so reduced, there are sadly many {bloodname} bloodnames that have been left vacant. I would encourage you to claim one.
Will you compete for a bloodname?
storyPoint.choice: Yes, I will claim my bloodright.
No, I have had enough of fighting for now.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_black_widow_dead
storyPoint.title: Vlad's Question
storyPoint.question:
Is it true? Is the Chalcas Black Widow finally dead? Are we finally free of her taint?
Tell me how she died.
storyPoint.choice: She died as a warrior, in single combat. Her sacrifice allowed the rest of our forces to withdraw from Twycross with minimal losses.
She died as an arrogant fool, burned to ash under the boot of an unremarkable Jade Falcon.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_leader1
storyPoint.title: Vlad Takes Charge
storyPoint.question:
*You quickly reconnoiter with Ulric and Vlad.*
Trial site is a large public square in Borealtown, about two clicks that way. We are likely to meet some resistance but our goal is to push through as quickly as possible and bring Ulric to his Trial. Follow my lead.
storyPoint.choice: Hold on one second, who made you the leader, *Star Captain?*
Lead the way, Star Captain Vlad.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_leader2
storyPoint.title: Vlad Takes Charge?
storyPoint.question:
*Vlad turns his Timber Wolf toward you in a quizzical way.*
What!? I am clearly the senior Star Captain. I am here at the special request of Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky.
storyPoint.choice: We are all here at the request of Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky.
Good point. I defer to you, Star Captain Vlad.

storyPoint.name: choice_wotan_ambush_success
storyPoint.title: Accept Surrender?
storyPoint.question:
*What was once a grand square is now a wasteland of wreckage. The smoking carcasses of metal giants lie all around you. Some are Jade Falcons, but many belong to your own forces. Yet, out of the smoke come more green meks. One of them hails you on your comm.*
Wolf commander, this is Star Captain Mel Ustone. You have fought with honor and skill. I ask you to accept defeat so that I will not be forced to kill a great warrior. I promise that you and your warriors will not remain bondsmen long.
*You look out at your few remaining warriors before responding.*
storyPoint.choice: Aff, I accept your proposal. Wolf or Jade Falcon matters little, so long as we can continue the fight.
Neg, you will have to destroy us to the last man before we become Jade Falcons.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_wake_up
storyPoint.title: You Awaken
storyPoint.question:
{commander}? .... Wake up, {commanderRank}! That is an order!
*You blink as the bright lights of the medbay seem to stab at your eyes. Above you floats the bruised face of Vlad.*
He is awake! {commander}, tell me, how are you feeling?
*As your vision comes back to you, you see several of your warriors standing behind Vlad. Vlad himself looks badly injured with a cast on his right arm and leg. He stands on crutches. You appear to be lying on a medical cot in a medbay somewhere.*
storyPoint.choice: I have never felt better.
I feel like I have been disassembled and put back together by a poorly trained *freebirth* tech.
Am I dead? If this is heaven, why are you here?

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_medbay_alive
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.question: By eliminating Ulric and absorbing a clan, Chistu is clearly aiming for the Ilkhanship. But he has reached too far. By murdering Ulric in such a treacherous manner he betrayed the principles of the Clans. The Jade Falcons are the most hide-bound of all the Clans. If evidence of his treachery is found, his own Clan will tear him to pieces.
storyPoint.choice: If this evidence is so damning, then how are you and I still alive?
He is a fool not to have covered his tracks better.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_medbay_review3
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.question:
*You slowly get to your feet. You feel slightly woozy, but are surprised to find no broken bones.*
You can stand. You must come with me. A private meeting with the Jade Falcon Khans awaits us. We will present this evidence to Elias Crichell and challenge Chistu to a Trial of Refusal.
storyPoint.choice: Why would Khan Crichell grant such a private meeting?
Why not just take this evidence to the full Clan Council?

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_meeting_khans4
storyPoint.title: Meeting with Khans
storyPoint.question:
*Now it is Vlad's turn to object.*
What!? Neg! I offered the challenge and I can fight! Chistu must fight me!
storyPoint.choice: You are in no shape to fight, Vlad. I can handle this one.
The challenge was issued by Vlad. He should be the one to fight.

storyPoint.name: choice_vlad_victory
storyPoint.title: Victory
storyPoint.question:
*As you strip off your neurohelmet and step out of the cockpit, you see a crowd of people rushing toward you, cheering. Vlad is the first to reach you.*
You have done it. Perhaps you cut it a little close, but you have done it. Clan Wolf survives and the Truce of Tukayyid is rejected. You and I will lead our Clan to Terra itself!
storyPoint.choice: To Terra!
Who said anything about *you*?
I did not just save the Wolf Clan to leave it in Crusader hands.

storyPoint.name: choice_crichell_khan_meeting1
storyPoint.title: Meeting with Khans
storyPoint.question:
They dispute your telling of how Ulric Kerensky died, Vandervahn.
*Vandervahn's face becomes pale. Elias Crichell looks toward you.*
You also claimed to witness this event. What did you see?
storyPoint.choice: Khan Chistu used a targeting laser to send overwhelming indirect missile fired at Ulric's mek after an individual trial had been declared.
This *stravag* lured Ulric into the open and murdered him with indirect missile fire after declaring an individual trial.

storyPoint.name: choice_crichell_kurultai
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.question:
*You stand before the assembled warriors of your Clan. The Refusal War has diminished the touman significantly and barely more than 200 faces gaze back at you.*
*Khan Elias Crichell stands in front of you.*
{commander}, why you are worthy of the {bloodname} bloodname?
storyPoint.choice: I won three trials to help guarantee the Wolves were represented among the Clans returning to the Inner Sphere. During the invasion, I fought on Kirchbach and Hohenems, helping to liberate both planets. On Tukayyid, I fought with honor. In this Refusal War, I have bested the Jade Falcons on Colmar, Baker 3, Devin, Denizli, and Wotan. I have been defeated only by the treachery of Vandervahn Chistu who is now slain by my hand.
I have slain a Khan and saved my Clan from Absorption.
Mostly, it is that I have killed a lot of Jade Falcons. *A lot*.

storyPoint.name: choice_vandervahn_end
storyPoint.title: Vandervahn's Fate
storyPoint.question:
*As you walk over to Chistu's fallen Executioner, his voice comes across your comm from a tight-beam transmission.*
You have defeated me. Make me your bondsman. You will find me very resourceful, and you will need me to deal with Crichell. He is not to be trusted.
storyPoint.choice: Neg, Chistu. I know that I cannot trust *you*.
So be it. You will become my bondsman. However, if I detect the slightest treachery, you will be cleaning latrines for the rest of your life.

storyPoint.name: choice_trial_mek
storyPoint.title: Which Mek?
storyPoint.question:
*You step into an assigned mek bay to prepare for the Trial and are surprised when your chief tech is there to greet you.*
Greetings, {commander}. Since the battle, they have me working as a bondsman tech, but I was just ordered to get over to this mek bay on the double to support you for a Trial. Scuttlebut says it is to get our Clan back. I sure as hell hope so, because this Falcon jumpsuit itches like you would not believe.
Anyway, first thing we need to do is get you a mek, since pretty much everything we had is in the salvage pile. Your opponent is going to be in a *Executioner* although I do not know the configuration. If you want to go for a similar assault mek, I could put you in a *Warhawk*. Alternatively, I could put you in something a little lighter, faster, and more iconic like the *Timber Wolf*. If you want to really go for speed, I can put you in a *Stormcrow* and you can try to run circles around him.
So, what will it be?
storyPoint.choice: Warhawk Prime
Warhawk A
Warhawk B
Warhawk C
Warhawk D
Timber Wolf Prime
Timber Wolf A
Timber Wolf B
Timber Wolf C
Timber Wolf D
Stormcrow Prime
Stormcrow A
Stormcrow B
Stormcrow C
Stormcrow D

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_sitrep
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
As you know, Ulric organized your ad-hoc trinary mostly from young and idealistic Wolf warriors. Your job is to whip them into a fighting force that can carry on the legacy of Clan Wolf, however this conflict ends. At the moment, I am not assigning you to a cluster but rather keeping you in my back pocket as a reserve force to be used as needed.
I had hoped to keep you in that pocket a little longer, but the dezgra Falcons on Colmar have called in their reserve bid and are pushing through our lines in the Marakaa Valley. I need you to grab your command star and go plug some holes, immediately. Show these young pups what it means to be a warrior of Clan Wolf!

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_drop
storyPoint.title: Welcome to the LZ!
storyPoint.narrative:
Hello, {commander}. I am Star Commander Louisa and I will be commanding your transport Dropship, *Moonhowler*, for this offensive. We are immediately over the LZ and will be coming down hard. Please brace yourself.
*G-forces glue you to your seat. You can hear and feel the roar of the engines from below. After minutes of sustained pressure, it eases suddenly with an abrupt jolt.*
And that is touchdown. Prepare bays for egress.
*You hear the distant sound of hydraulic motors.*
We have landed and are ready to dismount your forces. All the information you need is available in the on-board briefing room. Good hunting, {commanderRank}!

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_debrief1
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
It looks like your pups cut some teeth today, {commanderRank}. As you saw, the Falcons are not honoring us with zellbrigen, so I would recommend that you return the favor for the foreseeable future.
You are free to take bondsmen where you have the opportunity. However, keep in mind that such bondsmen are not allowed to join our ranks as warriors until after this war is over, except in special circumstances. Those are the Khan's orders. Given the enmity between our Clans, its unlikely many would want their bondcords cut anyway.
I am happy to report that the Falcon presence on Colmar has been eliminated. I will be taking my Wolf Spiders to officially liberate the capital.

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_debrief2
storyPoint.title: Time to Go
storyPoint.narrative: You should return to your dropship and get busy with repairs. We will travel with Khan Phelan Ward's forces to Sudeten for another round of hunting green birds.

storyPoint.name: narr_colmar_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Back on board
storyPoint.narrative: Welcome back, {commanderRank}. Once you have your meks secured in their bays, I am ready to boost for orbit. From there, we are headed to Sudeten along with the rest of the joint task force. I have already mapped in coordinates, so you don't need to worry about the details. You can check on our travel progress from the on-board interstellar map, if you like. The trip should give you enough time to deal with any battle damage and injuries.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_intro
storyPoint.title: Tech Chat
storyPoint.narrative:
Hello, {commander}. I am the chief tech on board here. I see you have been out busting up my machines. Do not worry, my team can fix almost anything, so we will get right on it. You can head over to the repair bay to check on our progress.
We have quite a few parts and equipment in storage aboard the ship, but keep in mind that once those supplies are used up, we do not have access to anything more, given wartime shortages. So if you want to make sure you stay in supply, you will want to be sure to salvage whatever isorla you can from your battles. You can always check on our supplies by heading over to the warehouse.
Also keep in mind that we have no way to acquire new units given the situation. We do have some second-line meks mothballed in the hangar bay, that can be used to replace units that have been completely destroyed or do not have available parts. It will take some time to pull those units out of mothball, though, so be sure to give me some advance warning.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_baker3
storyPoint.title: Tech Chat
storyPoint.narrative: Hello, {commander}. Just be sure to let me know which units you are sending out on which assignments, so that I can get them ready to go. You can do that from your on-board TO&E screen. You won't be able to start the assignments until you have assigned units to them.

storyPoint.name: narr_doctor_intro
storyPoint.title: Doc Chat
storyPoint.narrative:
Greetings, {commander}. I am the doctor assigned to the *Moonhowler*. If you have any wounded MekWarriors from this battle or future battles, be sure to send them to the infirmary so that I may treat them.
I know that the ego of many MekWarriors is such that they are too proud to admit to their injuries, but it is imperative that they do so. If they are not sent to the infirmary, natural healing will take much longer.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_choice_warhawk
storyPoint.title: You Chose Warhawk
storyPoint.narrative:
Good choice, {commanderRank}. You cannot go wrong with that beast. It may not have the tonnage of the *Executioner* but it sure does pack a punch!
I will get to work on it right away. We should have your mek ready for combat shortly. Give him hell, {commanderRank}!

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_choice_timber_wolf
storyPoint.title: You Chose Timber Wolf
storyPoint.narrative:
I hoped you would pick that one, {commanderRank}. What better way to restore the honor of Clan Wolf than with our iconic mek!
I will get to work on it right away. We should have your mek ready for combat shortly. Give him hell, {commanderRank}!

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_choice_timber_wolf
storyPoint.title: You Chose Stormcrow
storyPoint.narrative:
Excellent idea, {commanderRank}. You will easily outpace his slow ass in that ride.
I will get to work on it right away. We should have your mek ready for combat shortly. Give him hell, {commanderRank}!

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_bloodname_trial
storyPoint.title: Preparing for the Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
So tomorrow is the big day, huh? You let us know if you want to make any changes or need any repairs to the mek you want to use for each battle. Depending on your opponent, you may want to swap your loadout, or even change your ride entirely.
We will also be ready to repair your mek right after battle. If you don't bang it up too much, we should be able to get it ready for the next day's combat.
Good luck, {commanderRank}.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_victory
storyPoint.title: Victory
storyPoint.narrative:
*Before Vlad can respond, you are mobbed by other Wolves ready to offer their congratulations.*
I told you that was the right mek for the fight! Glad to see you managed to win without totally wrecking my equipment.
I will be so glad to get this malfing green jumpsuit off. It is definitely not my color.

storyPoint.name: narr_arrive_sudeten
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Sudeten
storyPoint.narrative: Welcome to Sudeten, {commander}. I think it is time to let Khan Ward have some fun, quiaff? Unfortunately, that means your services will not be needed here. While Khan Ward rolls up the Falcons on Sudeten, you will travel with me to Baker 3 for our next date with the Falcons. Make sure you're ready to dance.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Baker 3
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome to Baker 3, {commanderRank}! At this point, you have no doubt heard the rumors about Khan Ward's task force. After smashing the Falcons on Sudeten, his entire task force was diverted at my command to the Inner Sphere where they will help prepare the Spheroids for a resumption of hostilities with our brethren. He brought with him the entire genetic repository of our Clan.
Like every other damn warrior in this Touman, you probably have your own opinions about my decision. Frankly, I don't give a damn. From an operational standpoint, all it means is that we will not have Khan Ward's forces available to us. I will, therefore, need to lean more heavily on my existing forces, including yours. In other words, I hope you got all the dents out of your meks because I am going to need them shortly.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_sitrep
storyPoint.title: Baker 3 Sitrep
storyPoint.narrative: We will be tackling Baker 3 with a two-pronged assault. Most of our forces will distract the Falcons with a straightforward assault. The remaining forces will use the heat of the hot spring-fed waters of the Baker River to march upriver and directly into the Falcon's rear area. I would like you to contribute a Star to each operation. You are welcome to choose which warriors to assign, but we will drop into the LZ in two hours, so get them ready now.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_debrief_success
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: Excellent work, {commander}. Our strike into the rear of the Falcon line has thrown them into disarray. The loss of supplies and communications from your successful mission has been particularly notable. It is just mop up work at this point, so I am sending you back to your dropship for repair and resupply.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_debrief_failure
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: I expected better from you, {commander}. Happily, despite your failure to achieve the objectives I gave you, our little adventure has been a rousing success. The surprise attack has thrown the Falcons into disarray, and all that is left to do is a bit of mopping up. Since your units clearly must be in dire need of repair to leave the field so hastily, I am sending you back to your dropship for repair and resupply. Think on your failure and do better next time.

storyPoint.name: narr_baker3_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Time for Liftoff
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome back on board, {commanderRank}. From the way the Falcons are folding, I trust that you gave them hell.
I just received a comm that Baker 3 has been secured, and we are to begin transit to the jump point. Our next destination is Devin. Please secure all equipment and personnel for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Devin
storyPoint.narrative: We have now arrived at the ball of dust and sand they call Devin. I am going to give the Silver Devils the call-up on this one, so you should just stand by in orbit. With luck, we should make short work of the Second Falcon Jaegers stationed on planet.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_sitrep
storyPoint.title: Devin Sitrep
storyPoint.narrative: Well, things have gone pear-shaped down on Devin. It seems the Falcons knew a big storm was coming on and used that to their advantage on the O'Tsung Plain. Our forces are making a fighting withdrawal to their dropships. I need you to make a combat drop near the front lines and hold off the Falcons long enough to evacuate as many of our forces as we can. We are not going to win this one {commander}, but we may be able to turn a killing blow into a flesh wound if your young pups have the mettle to see it through.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_drop
storyPoint.title: Devin Combat Drop
storyPoint.narrative:
We are dropping into a major storm, {commanderRank}, so this is going to be a rough landing. Please be sure everything is secured in the hangar bay, and we will try to get you down in one piece.
*Shortly after, you are buffeted about in your combat seat from the heavy winds hitting the descending dropship.*
Bring us down tight and steady, pilot! You flip this egg, and you pay for it!
*You can hear the metal struts supporting the hull groan with the pressure. Then you feel an abrupt and heavy jerk as your mek rocks on its actuators. As the bay doors begin to open, sand is blown across the metal floors of the hangar bay by the howling winds outside.*
And that is touchdown! You are clear for egress, {commanderRank}. Good hunting!

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_debrief_success
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: I am sorry to say we got our asses handed to us on Devin. We were not prepared for that storm. It was bound to happen at some point in this campaign, but it could have been a lot worse without the quick actions of your forces, {commanderRank}. Excellent work. Now we lick our wounds and move on to Denizli.

storyPoint.name: narr_devin_debrief_failure
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
I am sorry to say we got our asses handed to us on Devin. We were not prepared for that storm. It was bound to happen at some point in this campaign. I know your young pups fought hard, but unfortunately enough of their forces made it through your blockade to take out one of the Third Battle Cluster's dropships. They are now a shadow of their former selves, and I am going to send the remainder of that cluster to join Khan Ward.
Now we lick our wounds and move on to Denizli.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Denizli
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome to Denizli, {commander}. The garrison forces here should not prove too difficult. I will not need you for the main assault, but I am going to throw your forces a bone to chew on.
There is an important oil refinery in the northern continent that is being guarded by a small garrison unit. The commander of that force is ... well, best you see for yourself. I am assigning your forces to take that facility. I'm also giving you free rein to handle it as you see fit.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_drop
storyPoint.title: Denizli Combat Drop
storyPoint.narrative:
{commander}, I am over the LZ now and will begin combat drop procedures shortly. This drop should be a lot smoother than the--
*There is a brief pause, as the comm drops out before coming back on.* {commanderRank}, I am getting an incoming transmission from an individual claiming to be the commanding officer of the Jade Falcon forces on site. He wants to speak with you regarding the batchall. I am putting him through.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_full_succ
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
*Natasha fixes you with an incredulous stare.*
An old man with ten beat-up second class meks and mostly freebirth warriors, and you decide to go after him with everything you have? Well, that wasn't exactly honorable, but I guess I can appreciate your ruthlessness. Well done, {commanderRank}. I always figured that was a milk run for you, but it ought to bolster the morale of your troops. They are going to need it because Twycross is going to be a lot harder nut to crack. Prepare for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_full_fail
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
*Natasha wears a rueful smile.*
In a certain sort of way, I am impressed {commanderRank}. Your forces significantly outnumbered an old man with mostly freebirth warriors in second class machines and you *still* got your ass handed to you. Maybe now you have a little more respect for age and wisdom.
Well, you better start licking your wounds because with troop losses elsewhere I am going to need you on Twycross. Prepare for liftoff. That is all.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_equal_succ
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: A very honorable decision, {commanderRank} to fight the opponent with equal forces when you could have overwhelmed them with numbers. It could have also been a tactical error to give up your advantage, except for the fact that you outclassed your opponent in unit and pilot quality. Just don't make that tactical error when it matters. Speaking of which, we are off to Twycross where we will face a far more fearsome foe than an old man with a taste for ancient legends. Prepare for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_equal_fail
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: Throwing away your advantage was foolish {commanderRank}. Still, given the inferior quality of your opponent, you should have come out victorious. Losing to a dotty old man with a taste for Greek myth is a bit of stain on your record. Perhaps you will be able to wipe it clean on Twycross, our next destination. Prepare for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_single_succ
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: So you humored the old man's request for "Trojan" combat? He threw down the same challenge to me when we entered orbit. I didn't realize you were such a romantic. Now throwing away your tactical advantage like that could have been a mistake, but given your superior quality, you were able to see it through. Excellent work, {commanderRank}, but be more careful about making tactical errors in the future. We are headed off to Twycross now, and you won't find any dotty old historians there. Prepare for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_debrief_single_fail
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative: So you humored the old man's request for "Trojan" combat? He threw down the same challenge to me when we entered orbit. Your taste for romanticism cost you an easy victory, {commanderRank}. Please be sure you do not make the same tactical blunder on Twycross, our next destination. Prepare for liftoff.

storyPoint.name: narr_denizli_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Secure for Liftoff
storyPoint.narrative: {commander}, welcome back on board. We kept it warm and toasty for you. As soon as you get your meks secured, we have orders to make for the nadir jump point. Scuttlebut says we are headed for Twycross next.

storyPoint.name: narr_twycross_arrive
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Twycross
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome to Twycross, {commander}, site of the Jade Falcon's greatest shame. I think we should make them relive that trauma.
With battle attrition, our forces are worn a bit thin, so I am putting you in the front-line for the coming battle. The plan is simple. We will invite the Falcons to attack our forces on the Plain of Curtains in front of the Great Gash. Once the emerald birds are fully engaged, we will withdraw through the Gash. When they follow us, the warriors I have placed at strategic points throughout the Great Gash will rain fire down upon them. I realize some may find it a dishonorable tactic, but I don't really care. Suit up and prepare to form up on my left flank.

storyPoint.name: narr_twycross_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Secure for Liftoff
storyPoint.narrative:
{commander}, welcome back on board. Star Colonel Marco Hall has taken command of our task force, and we have orders to rendezvous with Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky in the Butler system.
*She pauses briefly and then her face turns ashen.*
We have just received word that Khan Kerensky has fallen in the Great Gash to a Falcon warrior named Joanna. It is ... It is just hard to believe that she is gone.
*She seems to pull herself together.*
Please secure all personnel and vehicles for immediate departure. May the ghost of the Black Widow haunt these damn Jade Falcons for as long as they hold this cursed planet.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_arrive1
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Butler
storyPoint.narrative: You arrive at Butler, along with the remnants of Khan Natasha Kerensky's task force. Here you are to meet up and join forces with Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky's task force. You arrive at the jump point to find it teeming with Wolf transports. Shortly, you receive an urgent message from Star Captain Vlad.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_arrive2
storyPoint.title: Priority Communique
storyPoint.narrative: My apologies for interrupting, {commander}, but I have a priority communication coming through from Star Colonel Ulric Kerensky, himself. I am patching it over to your screen, now.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_drop
storyPoint.title: Travel to Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
{commander}, We have been given permission to land on Butler for the Trial of Refusal as requested. I should have you on the ground shortly.
*There is a pause as if she is considering whether to say something else.*
Good hunting, {commanderRank}. I hope you teach that stravag fool some respect.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_liftoff
storyPoint.title: Onward to Exile
storyPoint.narrative: I am glad to see that it is you I am welcoming back on board, {commander}. Once you are secured, we are ready for liftoff. A jumpship is waiting at the nadir point to carry us to Morges. I will be proud to stand with Khan Phelan's Wolves.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_liftoff2
storyPoint.title: Onward to Exile
storyPoint.narrative: Aye, {commanderRank}. I am not sad to see them go frankly, although I wish I could have prevented their stravag theft of equipment. Once you are secured, we are ready for liftoff. A jumpship is waiting at the nadir point to carry us to Morges. I will be proud to stand with Khan Phelan's Wolves.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_liftoff3
storyPoint.title: Onward to Wotan
storyPoint.narrative: Aye, {commanderRank}. I hope we lose no more. As soon as the dropship is clear, the fleet is scheduled to begin jump procedures.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_liftoff4
storyPoint.title: Onward to Exile
storyPoint.narrative:
Greetings, {commanderRank}. A jumpship is waiting at the nadir point to carry us to Morges. Please, prepare for acceleration.
I will be proud to stand with Khan Phelan's Wolves.

storyPoint.name: narr_butler_liftoff5
storyPoint.title: Onward to Wotan
storyPoint.narrative: Greetings, {commanderRank}. A flotilla of jumpships is waiting at the nadir point to carry us to Wotan. Please, prepare for acceleration.

storyPoint.name: narr_morges_arrival
storyPoint.title: Welcome to Morges
storyPoint.narrative:
Welcome to Morges, {commander}. We are entering orbit, and I am trying to raise communication with--
Wait! I have an urgent incoming communication directly from Khan Phelan. I am routing it directly to you.

storyPoint.name: narr_morges_convoy_debrief_success
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
Excellent work, {commanderRank}. With their supply line cut, the Falcon meks started running dry, and we pushed them all the way back to their rally point at the Bay of Broken Hope.
Now I have something special planned for the Falcons. You should join my forces as we march on the Bay of Broken Hope. I will speak with you more once we arrive.

storyPoint.name: narr_morges_convoy_debrief_failure
storyPoint.title: Post-Mission Report
storyPoint.narrative:
Unfortunately, enough of the convoy survived to keep the Falcon fighting for a little longer. It cost me more than I would have liked, but we finally were able to push them back.
They are regrouping at the Bay of Broken Hope. Before they launch their next offensive, I have something special planned. You should join my forces as we march on the Bay of Broken Hope. I will speak with you more once we arrive.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive1
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Wotan
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric's face flickers onto your screen and the screen of every member of this strike force.*
We have arrived at Wotan. As I predicted, we have caught the Jade Falcons by surprise. Lacking the guile of the Wolves, they could not envision such a bold maneuver.
We will keep them off-guard by immediately dropping everything we have onto Wotan. The goal is the elimination of the remaining Jade Falcons as a viable fighting force. I don't expect that many of us will survive this fight, but our sacrifice will ensure the survival of Clan Wolf. The Wolves will live on, even if the Wolf dies. Go with honor, my trothkin, and earn your place in the Remembrance.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive2
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Wotan
storyPoint.narrative:
*The screen flickers for a moment but Ulric's face remains.*
For you, {commander}, I have a special assignment. I have challenged saKhan Chistu of the Jade Falcons to a personal trial. You and your trinary are to accompany me to the site of this trial as an honor guard, along with Star Captain Vlad. It is likely we will have to fight our way in.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive3
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Wotan
storyPoint.narrative:
*The screen flickers to a new view.*
I tell you again, Star Colonel. If you would just allow me my own trinary, these additional forces would not be necessary. We are more than capable of providing your honor guard.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive4
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Wotan
storyPoint.narrative:
Vlad, you once again misunderstand my purpose. {commander} is here as a proper honor guard. *You* are here because I feel the need to keep an eye on you.
We will drop in 30 minutes. I have sent your dropship commander the rendezvous point.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive5
storyPoint.title: Final Drop
storyPoint.narrative:
Strap yourself in {commanderRank}. This could be a bumpy ride.
*You strap yourself in. After several minutes of waiting in silence in the cockpit of your mek, you are suddenly thrown violently to the left and right as the Moonhowler executes evasive action.*
Sorry, {commanderRank}. The drop zone is a little hot right now, but nothing I cannot handle. We should be landing shortly.
*G-forces push you into your seat as the thunder of engines tells you that you are coming in for a landing. After minutes, you feel the g-forces lift, followed by the familiar sound of the dropship hitting dirt.*
Lifting bay doors now.... You are clear for egress. Good hunting, {commander}.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_arrive6
storyPoint.title: The Streets of Borealtown
storyPoint.narrative:
*You make your way through city streets that have already seen fighting. Much of the current fighting has moved away from this zone, leaving it eerily quiet.*
*As you near your destination, angry red dots show up on your sensors ahead. Enemy forces are incoming!*

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_honor
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Khan Kerensky rolls her eyes slightly.*
Kissing my ass is not going to earn you a bloodname, {commanderRank}. Still, I appreciate the fact that I have to watch out for one less knife in my back.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_duty
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Kerensky gives you a quizzical look.*
Spoken like a true soldier. However, I thought Clan Wolf bred warriors and not soldiers. Who has been tainted by the Inner Sphere now? Nonetheless, perhaps we will have need of more soldiers if we are to survive what is coming.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_farce
storyPoint.title: A Khan's Greeting
storyPoint.narrative:
*Kerensky's lips quirk upward into a slight smile before she barks out a laugh.*
Get in line, {commanderRank}. I do appreciate your honesty. If I had more time to deal with you and all the rest of my critics, I might honor you with a proper ass whooping, as they say in the Inner Sphere. As it is, you will have to take a rain check.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_loser
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: Luck is an inherent part of combat. Not every bloodname trial picks the best warrior. I am sure you will get your opportunity in the future.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_wound
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: One of the many costs of Tukayyid, earned by our arrogance and paid by your blood. Nonetheless, I am sure you will get your opportunity in the future.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_cool
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: Is that so? Very unusual for a clan warrior to turn their back on our traditions. However, once this war is over, I fear there may be so many vacancies that you will have no choice but to earn a bloodname.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_ward
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: The most famed and honored of all the bloodnames of our Clan. Well, except for mine, of course.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_radick
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: A true warrior bloodname, if perhaps too well known for its tendency toward savagery.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_carns
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative: A solid workhorse bloodname, perhaps unlucky to exist in a clan of Wards and Kerenskys.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_vickers
storyPoint.title: Clan Heritage
storyPoint.narrative:
A Widowmaker bloodline? What happens when the Black Widow meets the Widowmaker, {commander}?
Don't answer that. It was a rhetorical question.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_sacrifice
storyPoint.title: Time to Withdraw
storyPoint.narrative:
*Her laughter comes over the comm.*
Why do you assume I will lose, {commander}? I admit the odds are stacked against me, but I woke feeling as spry as a young sibkin on the eve of their Trial of Position. I feel like I can handle a Cluster or two.
You have proven yourself a skilled leader. You don't need me. Go finish off the rest of these birds with Ulric and then come back for me, {commander}. Black Widow, out.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_remembrance
storyPoint.title: Time to Withdraw
storyPoint.narrative:
Hah, sounds good, although they might have to edit out a few parts of my life story for it to be solemn enough for that dusty old book. It satisfies me enough to know that I lived a full life and maybe today I will have a glorious death. Or maybe not, because these Falcons don't look too eager to dance.
You have proven yourself a skilled leader, {commander}. Go finish off the rest of these birds with Ulric and then come back for me. Black Widow, out.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_solahma
storyPoint.title: Time to Withdraw
storyPoint.narrative:
You're going to be a cuss right to the end, aren't you? Oh well, you may have a point. I can feel the strain in my back and legs today, and maybe I would rather die a glorious death here now then in some nursery, wiping the noses of sibko brats.
You may be a cantankerous son of a bitch, but you have proven yourself a skilled leader, {commander}. Go finish off the rest of these birds with Ulric. Black Widow, out.

storyPoint.name: narr_natasha_final
storyPoint.title: The Black Widow's Challenge
storyPoint.narrative:
*As your units withdraw through the shadowed canyons of the Great Gash, A *Dire Wolf* moves past you in the other direction. Shortly afterward, you hear Natasha Kerensky's voice over the general frequency.*
I am Natasha Kerensky of Clan Wolf. I have sent my troops away. I await in the Great Gash of Twycross to meet and slay any Jade Falcon who thinks more of himself than he should and prefers courage to wisdom. Come now. Your time is at hand.
*As you oversee the boarding of your trinary's meks into the *Moonhowler*, you feel a mixture of pride and concern and wonder whether that Dire Wolf will ever come out of the Great Gash again.*

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_intro
storyPoint.title: Sad Tidings
storyPoint.narrative:
I was deeply saddened to hear of Khan Kerensky's death on Twycross. It is, however, some consolation that she met a warrior's end and certainly earned a place in the Remembrance.
She spoke highly of your abilities in combat, and I believe it is due in part to you that Twycross did not turn out worse for our forces. For that, you have my respect and gratitude.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_natasha_warrior
storyPoint.title: The Black Widow Died a Warrior's Death
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric gives you a slight nod.*
I am glad to see that this campaign has given you some measure of wisdom. Khan Kerensky's death is truly a great loss for our clan, but we must push on. Her sacrifice will not be the last, I am afraid.
Now, it is time for you to make a choice.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_natasha_failure
storyPoint.title: The Black Widow Failed
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric looks away briefly before fixing you with a steady gaze.*
Stubborn to your Crusader's loyalties until the last. No matter. We need not talk of other's sacrifices when there are so many more that lie ahead of us.
You will join my task force for the final assault on Wotan. It is unlikely that we will survive, but we will make them pay for our deaths dearly. I suggest you return to your dropship and prepare your warriors for battle. We lift in an hour.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_decision_wotan
storyPoint.title: A Decision Made
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric regards you for a moment before nodding his assent.*
You are a noble warrior. I might have wished to have you carry on the Warden legacy, but I will not deny you your chance of honor and glory. We lift off for Wotan in an hour. You best prepare your warriors for what is to come.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_decision_morges
storyPoint.title: A Decision Made
storyPoint.narrative:
*Ulric smiles as if a burden has been released.*
I have no doubt that honor and glory await you in the future, {commander}. I rest easier knowing the future is in good hands.
You must travel to Morges where Khan Ward is preparing his forces for the inevitable Jade Falcon attack. Go with honor, {commanderRank}.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_goodbye
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative:
*As you approach an open square you see a lone Gladiator in Jade Falcon colors. Ulric opens his mike.*
The Circle of Equals will take place here. You should wait here at the perimeter, while Vlad accompanies me within. If I do not survive this encounter, it has been an honor to fight with you, {commander}.
*You watch as Ulric approaches the lone Gladiator.*
Greetings, Vahn.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_circle1
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative: While you might consider them seconds, I consider them witnesses.

storyPoint.name: narr_ulric_circle2
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative: I prefer not to rely exclusively on technology. Do you require a formal declaration, or shall we begin?

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_greeting
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative: Greetings to you, Ulric. I had no idea you would be bringing seconds to this duel.

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_circle1
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative: My gun-camera video should be sufficient to certify your death.

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_circle2
storyPoint.title: Circle of Equals
storyPoint.narrative: We have already begun, Ulric.

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting1
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative:
*Some time later, you sit in Khan Elias Crichell's private chambers. Across from you sit the two Jade Falcon Khans. Vandervahn Chistu regards you both with a contemptuous air. He looks at Vlad.*
So you are the last Wolf? I do not believe we have met before.

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting2
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative:
*Chistu stands angrily.*
These are outrageous lies! I have been dishonored by these insults!

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting3
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: Disputing the nature of Ulric's death?

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting4
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: Then we shall have a Trial of Refusal. The fight will be to settle the issue of Absorption.

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting5
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative:
*I* am a Khan as well, in case you have forgotten, Elias. *I* grant this request to challenge me over the absorption.
*Chistu looks disparagingly at Vlad.*
However, I cannot fight a crippled warrior, nor wait for your recovery. I must fight your second instead.
*Chistu nods in your direction.*

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_khan_meeting6
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative:
Bargained well and done. It is settled. We shall fight in a Trial of Refusal. There is no need to delay any longer, let us finish it today. After I crush you, the Wolves will finally be dead. I will see you on the battlefield.
*Chistu sweeps from the room.*

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_death
storyPoint.title: Vandervahn's Fate
storyPoint.narrative:
*You fire an alpha strike into the cockpit of Vandervahn's Executioner, leaving a smoking ruin. Whatever final screams he might have made are drowned out by the sounds of metal popping and steam hissing. All that remains is a smoking carcass. Vandervahn Chistu is no more.*
*As you make your way back into the mek bay, you are dimly aware of a crowd chanting and cheering.*

storyPoint.name: narr_vandervahn_spared
storyPoint.title: Vandervahn's Fate
storyPoint.narrative:
You will not regret it, I swear! With my resourcefulness and cunning and your skills, we will soon rule Clan Wolf.
*You leave Chistu to be freed by techs that have run onto the field. As you make your way back into the mek bay, you are dimly aware of a crowd chanting and cheering.*

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_khan_meeting2
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: No! I never agreed to such a thing when I granted permission for this battle to take place. I revoke that permission and without it, a Khan cannot be challenged.

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_khan_meeting3
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: On this issue, I am in agreement with saKhan Chistu. Vlad is in no condition to participate in a Trial. {commander}, you will fight for the survival of your Clan. The Trial will commence as soon as we are able to arrange it. You best prepare.

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_victory
storyPoint.title: Victory
storyPoint.narrative:
*The crowd parts as Khan Elias Crichell pushes his way through. He wears a smile that does not reach his eyes.*
Well fought, {commander}. You have a won a Trial of Refusal over the Absorption of the Wolves. I hereby declare Clan Wolf restored, although the cowards who fled into the Inner Sphere will remain Abjured.
*A cheer goes up from all those around you.*
You will need to elect new leadership for your Clan. I will prepare a Kurultai for that purpose, two days hence.

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_bloodname_recite
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
*Crichell nods, seemingly appreciative of your traditional recitation.*
Your claims are of merit and have been verified. You shall now face your first opponent.
*Crichell waves you forward to where five Wolf warriors stand in a line.*

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_bloodname_restore
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
*Crichell narrows his eyes at your unorthodox answer.*
Your claims are of merit and have been verified. You shall now face your first opponent.
*Crichell waves you forward to where five Wolf warriors stand in a line.*

storyPoint.name: narr_crichell_bloodname_killer
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
*Crichell is visibly surprised by your lack of decorum. For a second, you can see he is reconsidering. Then he regains his composure.*
Your claims are of merit and have been verified. You shall now face your first opponent.
*Crichell waves you forward to where five Wolf warriors stand in a line.*

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_defend_natasha
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.narrative:
*Mathius's eyes narrow dangerously.*
Our clan is being corrupted from within by these surat Wardens and yet you would defend her? It is good at least to know where your loyalties lie. Perhaps, when this is all over, a trial of annihilation will wipe the taint from our ranks.

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_agree
storyPoint.title: A Disgrace?
storyPoint.narrative: It is good to see that at least some of our warriors respect the old ways, the ways of the Founder. When this is all over, I hope that I can trust you to help me cleanse this rot from within.

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_medbay
storyPoint.title: You Awaken
storyPoint.narrative:
*Mathius leans over Vlad's shoulder. His face is battered and bruised, and he is holding one of his arms gingerly.*
{commander}! You are alive, thank the Great Father. Vlad has just returned to us as well after digging himself out of the rubble. He brings dire tidings.

storyPoint.name: narr_mathius_victory
storyPoint.title: Victory
storyPoint.narrative: Well done, {commander}. You are a great warrior and I will follow you wherever you lead.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_yes
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*You see her shoulders relax as the tension leaves her body.*
I had hoped you would say so, {commanderRank}. I think that is how I feel as well. It was not always how I felt, but something changed for me on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_dont_know
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*She nods her head.*
I understand, {commanderRank}. I have felt conflicted as well.
I was not always so conflicted. I used to believe that it was our sacred heritage to conquer the Inner Sphere and redeem the work of the Great Father. But then everything changed on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_warden_no
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*She drops her head unwilling to meet your eyes.*
I am sorry to hear that you feel this way, {commanderRank}. I used to feel like that too. But then something changed for me on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_eleventh
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I know what it feels like to pay those costs. My unit, the Third Battle Cluster, was also devastated on Tukayyid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_silver_keshik
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I also served under Garth Radick's command, in the Third Battle Cluster of Beta Galaxy. He was a charismatic man and I found myself attracted to his Crusader beliefs. Or at least I did when we first touched down on Tukkayid.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_natasha_victory
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba nods her head vigorously.*
Without Natasha Kerensky and Phelan Ward, I believe that we would have failed on Tukkayid like so many other clans. They showed us the importance of being flexible and adaptable. Being stuck in one's ways is a recipe for defeat, quiaff? I learned that on Tukkayid, as well, in a more personal way.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_natasha_dezgra
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba shakes her head.*
But without Natasha Kerensky and Phelan Ward, surely we would have lost! There is no dishonor in learning to adapt to the enemy that one faces. Being stuck in one's ways is a recipe for defeat, quiaff? I learned that on Tukkayid, as well, in a more personal way.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_tukayyid_exp1
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
My unit, the third Battle Cluster was tasked with garrison duty when our forces pulled back to re-supply before the assault on Brzo. We did not expect the Comguards to hit us, but that is exactly what they did. Multiple divisions ambushed us. We were outnumbered three to one. We fought like hell and dished out more than we took, but we were decimated. I blacked out after my second ammo bin popped off.
When I came to, I was lying in the bedroom of a small farmhouse not far from the fighting. Apparently, I had dragged myself several miles from the battlefield before collapsing in an agricultural drainage ditch, although I remember none of it. A local farming family found me and took me in.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_tukayyid_exp2
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
They did not care that I was the enemy. I was just a person in need of help. They nursed me back to health. They had two children named Kate and Tynan. They would sit at the foot of my bed and ask me questions about life in the Clans for hours. They were curious, not afraid. When they were not questioning me, they would play games with me to keep me from getting bored. Kate would come in at night with a book so that I could read her a bedtime story.
Eventually, I recovered enough to travel, and I was returned to our clan in a prisoner exchange. I felt a pit in my stomach when I had to leave that family, knowing that I would likely never see them again.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_final_warden
