storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative:
I am pleased to hear you say it {commanderRank}. I just hope...
*She pauses.*
I just hope that we will have the opportunity to join Khan Ward in the future. It is not that I do not want to do my duty as a warrior, but rather that I would prefer to know what my sacrifice is for.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_final_crusader
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Concern
storyPoint.narrative: I am sorry to hear you say that {commanderRank}. You can be assured that I will do my duty as a warrior, regardless.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_howl
storyPoint.title: Tayyiba's Farewell
storyPoint.narrative:
*She smiles slightly.*
Yes, and may our enemies forever cower at the sound. Good hunting, {commanderRank}. *She turns to leave and the door to your quarters slides slowly shut behind her.*

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_coward
storyPoint.narrative:
*She looks down, avoiding your gaze.*
I had hoped you would not feel that way, even if I knew you probably would.
*She looks up with a fierce expression.*
I am no coward, but I do not expect you to understand.
*She turns quickly on her heel and exits your quarters, the door slowly sliding shut behind her.*

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_trial
storyPoint.narrative:
I know that must have been difficult, {commander}. Star Commander Mathius and I came up in the same sibko, and it has been hard to watch our views grow apart over the years. I felt like this conflict was inevitable. I hope you at least gave him a warrior's death.
I am thankful that we will be joining Khan Phelan on Morges. You can count on me in the coming fight, {commanderRank}.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_worth_it
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba drops her head.*
I want to believe that, but given everything that has happened, it is hard to accept. To live in exile away from our kin? To lose Ulric and Natasha? I hope that time will heal these wounds and show the wisdom of the decision.
*She stands up straight and looks intently at you.*
Regardless, it has been a pleasure to serve with you, {commander}. I hope that I will be able to continue to serve with you in our uncertain future.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_not_win
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba drops her head.*
I feel the same. We may have survived, but I cannot call this a win. Then I think about Kate and Tynan on Tukkayid. I may be exiled from my kin, but not from the family I have gained along the way.
*She stands up straight and looks intently at you.*
I consider you part of that family, {commander}. It has been an honor to serve with you. I hope that I will be able to continue to serve with you in our uncertain future.

storyPoint.name: narr_tayyiba_congrats
storyPoint.title: Congratulations
storyPoint.narrative:
*Tayyiba runs over and gives you a hug.*
I knew you could do it! I will be proud to serve with you in the Eleventh, {commander}. Together, perhaps we can show the Inner Sphere that we are not the monsters they think we are.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_help
storyPoint.narrative:
{commanderRank}! Boy, am I glad to see you.
*Sounds of explosion cut off any communication momentarily*.
We have been giving these Falcons a hard time, but in desperation, they have thrown most everything they have left at us and some units have penetrated the front lines in an unorthodox headhunter attack. My command star is now under heavy assault. I need you to combat drop on my position and hit these *stravag* Falcons from behind. You can thank me later for saving a few of these birds for you to chew on!

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_no_choice
storyPoint.title: A Grateful Khan
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan nods.*
If only other warriors came out of the iron womb with such wisdom, {commanderRank}. It would make our job a lot easier.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_shown_path
storyPoint.title: A Grateful Khan
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan grasps you firmly around the shoulders.*
{commander}, its never too late to learn these lessons, for you and others. In this, you could not have had better teachers than Ulric and Natasha. Now it is our turn to be the teachers.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_vlad_stinks
storyPoint.title: A Grateful Khan
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan laughs out loud.*
What is this? A clan warrior with a sense of humour? I think I shall enjoy your company, {commander}.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_morges
storyPoint.title: Situation on Morges
storyPoint.narrative:
The situation here on Morges has been on a razor's edge. The Falcons threw everything they could at us. With the help of the Kell Hounds, we have endured. I now have a plan underway to turn the tables on the jade birds and kick them off of Morges for good.
I will give you and your forces a few days time to repair and re-arm at our field base, but expect me to call on you again shortly.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_sitrep_convoy
storyPoint.title: Cut Their Supply Lines
storyPoint.narrative:
As promised {commanderRank}, I have returned with new orders that should bust this dance wide open.
The Jade Falcons have been pushing us hard since their loss at Icegrief Pass. They are loaded with ballistic weaponry for maximum destructive effect and it has been effective. However, they are now running low on ammunition.
Earlier today, the Kell Hounds intercepted a transmission indicating that a re-supply convoy was on its way from Broken Hope to Carson Rift to deliver much needed ammunition to the front line Falcon units. I can't spare many units for such a deep strike mission and moving troops from the front line might alert the Falcons to our intent. You, however, are new here and will likely be able to slip behind enemy lines and strike this convoy before it reaches Carson Rift.
The convoy will likely be well guarded, but those guards will be second line forces. Thus, I expect your battle hardened troops to make short work of them. Suit up, {commander}, I want you on the move in 30 minutes!

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_broken_hope1
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan waits for you on a bluff overlooking the Bay of Broken Hope. You can see Jade Falcon technicians and MekWarriors running frantically throughout the camp below as they prepare for the coming onslaught of Wolves. Ice and snow lie gleaming upon the bulbous tops of Jade Falcon dropships.*
Thank you for meeting me here. I wanted to show you something. We lost Tukkayid because the Inner Sphere understands the concept of Total War, but we do not. Today, I will teach that lesson to the Jade Falcons again.
*Suddenly, you hear the roar of jet engines above and look up to see the contrails of aerospace fighters diving toward the bay. The sky is filled with Wolf aerospace fighters.*

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_broken_hope2
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.narrative:
*Jade Falcon fighters launch from their dropships to meet these intruders in the sky. For minutes, the sky is a tangled mass of fighters, twisting and turning for advantage, as they stab at one another with PPC, laser, and missile.*
*Quickly, however, the Jade Falcons are overwhelmed by their numerical disadvantage, when multiple flights of Kell Hounds fighters join the fray. Freed from their aerial concerns, the Wolf fighters begin to strafe the camp. Explosions ripple through the camp, tearing apart flesh and steel. Realizing their exposed position, the Jade Falcons attempt to evacuate, but only one dropship makes it into the air, where it is torn apart by the combined Kell Hound fire.*
*Finally, the Wolf fighters cease their onslaught. A thick black fog hangs over the Jade Falcon camp, partially concealing a scene of utter devastation. The twisted remains of meks litter the ground, and survivors are seen limping here and there among the ruins.*

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_war_hell
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan nods solemnly.*
I take no pride or joy in what I have done here. But it is a lesson we all must learn if we are to face an uncertain future.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_dishonor
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan nods solemnly.*
I agree. They did deserve a better death. I take no pride or joy in what I have done here. As the Khan, this is my burden to bear.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_psycho
storyPoint.title: Broken Hope
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan's eyes widen in surprise.*
After the deaths of Natasha and Ulric, I can understand why you would feel this way. But they did not have it coming. They deserved better. However, my commitment to the survival of the Wolves means I could not give them what they deserve. As the Khan, this is my burden to bear.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_bloodname_yes
storyPoint.title: Earn a bloodname
storyPoint.narrative: Excellent. I am sure you will receive a nomination and avoid any Grand Melee. It may take a little time to organize trials. In the meantime, you should focus on rest and repair.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_bloodname_no
storyPoint.title: Earn a bloodname
storyPoint.narrative:
I understand, although I am disappointed. Clan Wolf is in need of leadership and leadership demands a bloodname. Perhaps after some time to rest and recuperate, you will reconsider. It will take time to organize so many trials anyway.
The war is over, {commanderRank}. I release you to your unit to rest and repair. Once we have dealt with the immediate aftermath of this war, I will call the Clan together for a final Kurultai to mark the occasion.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_bloodname_success
storyPoint.title: Trial Success
storyPoint.narrative:
You did it! I knew you were more than capable. It seems that your time has come, {commander}.
Yes, you heard that right - Star Colonel. Don't look so confused. I can hardly have a Star Captain commanding the Eleventh Wolf Guards, can I? Consider yourself their new commander, {commanderRank}. As part of our re-organization, I am going to assign all surviving members of your trinary to the Eleventh, so that they can continue to serve under you.
Soon, I will address our Touman at a final Kurultai that brings this war to an end and sets a vision for the future. I would like you at my side for this event.

storyPoints.storyPoint:
7c261b19-8633-4e4d-9fe3-f113869f0abe Trial Failure
It is unfortunate that you were not able to prevail, {commander}. I am sure that you will have the opportunity in the future to claim your bloodright once again. May fate favor you on that day.
Soon, I will address our Touman at a final Kurultai that brings this war to an end and sets a vision for the future. Bloodname or not, I would like you at my side at this event.
å 35fabd74-41fa-4472-b409-8a1d0c280418
e5ab5d97-2483-4358-85bd-cce8aa732e61

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai1
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
*The remaining warriors of Clan Wolf have gathered together in a large auditorium under dim lighting. All are quiet, and the only sound is the creak of ceremonial leathers, as Khan Phelan Ward ascends the podium to address the group. You, along with several others, stand behind him.*
I am the Oathmaster! All will be bound by this conclave until they are dust and memories and then beyond that until the end of all that is.
*The crowd intones as one - Seyla.*

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai2
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
We have defeated the Jade Falcons in combat.
*Cheers from the crowd.*
Yet, Khan Vandervahn Chistu claimed, after murdering Ulric Kerensky on Wotan, that *our* Trial of Refusal was, instead, *their* Trial of Absorption.
*The crowd erupts in cries of confusion and disbelief. Phelan quiets them with a hand.*
Thankfully, among the survivors of Wotan was one Wolf warrior named Vlad. He witnessed the treachery of Khan Chistu, firsthand, when he murdered Ulric Kerensky. He challenged Chistu to a Trial of Refusal over the absorption. Chistu was forced to accept and was slain in the fight.
*Cheers erupt from the crowd again.*

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai3
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
*Phelan looks suddenly solemn.*
Sadly, Vlad's victory does not mean that these Wolf survivors will be coming home. Khan Elias Crichell instead has dubbed these surviving Wolves as members of a new Jade Wolf Clan. Vlad was subsequently awarded a bloodname. Specifically, he was awarded *my* bloodname, for I, like all of you, have been *abjured.*
*The crowd erupts again into murmurs of discontent, before being quieted.*
The Jade Falcons have disowned us. The Jade Wolves will not claim us. Yet, in my heart, I know that we are the true Wolves. We will be the Wolves forever, and we will honor the vision of those who created the clans.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai4
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
There may be some among you who believe I am wrong, and wish to reconcile with the Jade Wolves. None will stand in your path if you choose to leave. I ask only that you respect those of us who wish to remain as true Wolves.
Here in the realm of my birth, I realize I still belong to the Inner Sphere. I will always take pride in being a Kell. Yet, I am equally proud of being a Wolf. I believe that by merging the best qualities of the Inner Sphere and the Clans, we can adapt and improve. I would happily continue to lead you.
*Phelan pauses and looks out at the crowd.*
But I cannot, for without a bloodname, I am no longer eligible to be a Khan.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai5
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
*As the crowd wails in protest, there is a commotion at the front of the crowd as an older man with an eye patch in white robes approaches the podium. He waves the shocked Phelan aside.* Thank you, Khan Phelan. I am Precentor Martial Anastasius Focht, and I am here to deliver a message entrusted to me by Ulric Kerensky. None have yet seen the message I display.
*A screen descends behind the Precentor Martial and, after a moment, the face of Ulric Kerensky appears.*
Greetings, my friends. If you are seeing this, I have been slain by the Jade Falcons and Phelan Ward has successfully moved our Touman to the Inner Sphere.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai6
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
This message concerns the future. It is the ilKhan's right to reward success. No higher honor can be bestowed than the creation of a new Bloodname. I, ilKhan Ulric Kerensky, create the Kell bloodname in honor of Phelan Ward Kell. He will be the first to bear this Bloodname.
*After momentary confusion, cheers erupt from the crowd, briefly drowning out Ulric's next words. Phelan stares at the screen in shock.*
You are embarking upon a grand mission that will determine the future of all humanity. Be true to your traditions. Never abandon what makes the Wolves strong, but adopt that which will make us stronger.

storyPoint.name: narr_phelan_kurultai7
storyPoint.title: Final Kurultai
storyPoint.narrative:
You mission is now to defend the Inner Sphere from the threat represented by the Clans. Who else could it be? You must stand united against the Crusaders on their path to destruction. You have Khan Phelan Kell to lead you and the courage to follow.
This is your destiny as Wolves and from it, you shall not shy.
*As Ulric's image fades out, the entire auditorium is momentarily silent. Then a single word spoken in absolute unity echoes out from every throat.*
Seyla!

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_alternate_full
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.narrative:
Of course, it is your right to commit what forces you wish, but little honor will come to the coward that simply overwhelms his opponent with superior numbers.
Perhaps I can offer an alternative that will restore your tattered honor. I propose we do as they did in the olden days. I have read much in my time as garrison commander, and I am particularly drawn to the stories of Greek history. Have you ever read of the fall of Troy by Homer? No, probably not I am guessing. There, the men fought honorably in one on one duels each striving to slay the other and claim more honor for himself. These duels were repeated over and over until one side proved victorious. This is how the Founder envisioned combat among the clans -- not these nasty, brutish affairs, but a series of singular trials in which each warrior could prove his might against the other. It harkens back not just to our heritage in the Clans, but indeed to all humankind.
I am rambling. This is what I suggest. Nine of my warriors will pair off in single challenges with a warrior from your side. Whichever side achieves the greatest number of victories in single combat will be proclaimed the victor.

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_alternate_equal
storyPoint.title: Batchall
storyPoint.narrative:
You are an honorable warrior to offer to fight me on equal terms when you could simply push your numerical advantage. Yet, I wish to offer you an alternative that would reap more glory and honor still.
I propose we do as they did in the olden days. I have read much in my time as garrison commander, and I am particularly drawn to the stories of Greek history. Have you ever read of the fall of Troy by Homer? No, probably not I am guessing. There, the men fought honorably in one on one duels each striving to slay the other and claim more honor for himself. These duels were repeated over and over until one side proved victorious. This is how the Founder envisioned combat among the clans -- not these nasty, brutish affairs, but a series of singular trials in which each warrior could prove his might against the other. It harkens back not just to our heritage in the Clans, but indeed to all humankind.
I am rambling. This is what I suggest. Nine of my warriors will pair off in single challenges with a warrior from your side. Whichever side achieves the greatest number of victories in single combat will be proclaimed the victor.

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_warrior
storyPoint.title: Well-Bargained and Done
storyPoint.narrative:
Excellent! You will not be disappointed {commander}. What with my combat experience and tactical brilliance, we will soon have these Jade Falcon surats (ooh that was fun to say!) running. I daresay we will have this campaign wrapped up in no time and our glory will be--
*You cut the mike, questioning what you have done.*

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_bondcord
storyPoint.title: Well-Bargained and Done
storyPoint.narrative:
But, of course. That is the customary way, after all. I assure you it will not take you long to realize the advantages that could accrue should you decide to cut my bondcord. My tactical expertise is quite extensive. I feel that it would be best, perhaps, if I serve in a capacity that would put me in close proximity to you so that I could share my wealth of tactical and strategic knowledge. Something like an aide-de-camp, quiaff? Yes, I think that would be most bene--
*You cut the mike, questioning what you have done.*

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_nobond
storyPoint.title: A Disappointed Solamha
storyPoint.narrative:
*He looks quite deflated.*
Well, I understand, I suppose. Many in the clans have not realized the vast expertise to be found among the more mature members. Why, I myself have a wealth of strategic and tactical knowledge. Do you know that I have read the entirety of Sun-Tzu Art of War as well as Musashi's Book of Five Rings? Why, you may want to reconsider once you hear---
*You cut the mike, feeling strongly that you made the right decision.*

storyPoint.name: narr_tobias_congrats
storyPoint.title: Congratulations
storyPoint.narrative:
Congratulations, indeed, {commanderRank}. The bloodname contest is truly the codex of the warrior distilled into a simple but reliable formula. I do find it so exciting, especially from the perspective of a new clan. You know, it really reminds of the epic poem of....
*Tobias trails off as others gather around you to celebrate.*

storyPoint.name: narr_louisa_congrats
storyPoint.title: Congratulations
storyPoint.narrative: I know I have not directly joined in on combat, but it has been an honor to serve with you {commander}. Your new rank and bloodname are well deserved. I know transportation assets get moved around pretty fluidly, but I would be happy to fly around your tin cans in my tin can anytime.

storyPoint.name: narr_louisa_victory
storyPoint.title: Victory
storyPoint.narrative:
Congratulations, {commander}. I had no doubt that you would be victorious. It feels good to be a Wolf again.
I do not know what the future holds and I know transportation assets get moved around pretty fluidly, but I would be happy to fly around your tin cans in my tin can anytime.

storyPoint.name: narr_tech_congrats
storyPoint.title: Congratulations
storyPoint.narrative: Congratulations, {commander}. Glad to see you managed to earn a bloodname without totally wrecking my - sorry, I mean your - mek. We will get right on it and get it back in mint condition in no time.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_black_widow_warrior
storyPoint.title: Vlad's Question
storyPoint.narrative: She died so that Clan warriors could ... *retreat*? What honor is there in this? She denied you glory in battle and yet you speak of her with fondness in your voice. You are a--

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_black_widow_fool
storyPoint.title: Vlad's Question
storyPoint.narrative:
*Vlad can barely contain his glee.*
I cannot imagine a better end to one such as Natasha Kerensky. May her name be stricken from the Remembrance. Now, if only the old man would do us the favor of dying as well so that we could repudiate this farcical "truce" and march again on--

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_leader
storyPoint.title: Arrival at Wotan
storyPoint.narrative:
*You hear Vlad's frustration in his voice.*
Time is of the essence, and we must not bicker any longer. We will *both* lead the way, {commander}. You may take point, while I guard the rear.
*As you head forth, Vlad cannot avoid one final reminder of his authority.*
Keep your head on a swivel, folks.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_post_battle
storyPoint.title: In the Thick of It
storyPoint.narrative:
*As the last of the Jade Falcons falls, You see a Timber Wolf emerge through the smoke behind you. You raise your weapons only to realize that it is Vlad's mek. You can see evidence of furious battle engraved upon its armored carapace.*
That takes care of the enemies to our rear. We are almost at the designated spot for the trial. Let us continue.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_trap
storyPoint.title: Its a Trap!
storyPoint.narrative:
*Caught off guard by this strange comment, you suddenly notice a small light emanating from Chistu's mek and seeming to probe Ulric's Gargoyle. Your heart races, as you realize something is wrong. Vlad, however, realizes it a second sooner.*
Ulric, it's a trap!
*The sky is suddenly blotted out by a battery of missiles arcing over the nearby buildings. Homing in on Ulric's position, they dive like angry hornets. There is no time to react. You are momentarily blinded by a massive explosion in the center of the square.*

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_great
storyPoint.title: You Awaken
storyPoint.narrative: Excellent, because I have need of you.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_terrible
storyPoint.title: You Awaken
storyPoint.narrative: Yes, that is how I felt after spending four days buried in my *Timber Wolf* with two broken limbs. The doctors tell me all your limbs are intact. So get up, warrior, as I have need of you.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_heaven
storyPoint.title: You Awaken
storyPoint.narrative: Your Spheroid sense of humor was not affected, apparently. You are not dead, and our work is not done. Get up, I have need of you.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_review
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.narrative: After he treacherously murdered Ulric, saKhan Vandervahn Chistu claimed that this whole Trial of Refusal was actually a Trial of Absorption. The Wolves who followed the *stravag* Phelan with their tails between their legs have been Abjured. If the remaining Wolves are Absorbed, then Clan Wolf will cease to exist. You and I are going to ensure that does not happen.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_review2
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.narrative:
*Vlad offers a predatory smile.*
He assumed I was dead, after being buried under a building. He ordered his troops to kill you and your forces to the last pilot. In this, he underestimated the resolve of the Wolf.
I survived and was freed by a salvage team. You fought so bravely that you earned the respect of the Star Colonel leading the assault. He refused to kill your warriors needlessly.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_why_grant
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.narrative:
Because Khan Crichell sees Vandervahn Chistu as a threat to his own goal of the Ilkhanship. He will shed no tears were Chistu to die.
Chistu himself would give anything to avoid the evidence of his treachery becoming public. I intend to use that to get my Clan back.
Come, we must not be late!

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_medbay_clan_council
storyPoint.title: State of Things
storyPoint.narrative:
Because Chistu would give anything to avoid the evidence of his treachery becoming public. I intend to use that to get my Clan back.
Come, we must not be late!

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_khan_meeting1
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: We have not met face-to-face, but I was there on Government Hill when you faced Ulric, as was my companion. I know what you did. I have already told Khan Crichell who has granted me permission to challenge you to personal combat over our differences.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_khan_meeting2
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative:
*Vlad angrily stands up as well.*
I demand a Trial of Refusal!

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_khan_meeting3
storyPoint.title: Meeting with the Khans
storyPoint.narrative: That is the least of our differences. You made a Trial of Refusal into a Trial of Absorption.

storyPoint.name: narr_vlad_khan_meeting5
storyPoint.title: Vlad's Wishes
storyPoint.narrative:
*As you leave the meeting, Vlad grabs you by the shoulder. His eyes burn through you with anger and frustration.*
It should have been me.
*He punches a wall with his cast and then screams in pain. After a few second, he takes a deep and slow breath.*
The fate of Clan Wolf is all that matters now. You must win this battle for us, {commander}. I have seen you fight and I have no doubts you will make short work of Chistu. May you honor the Clan.

storyPoint.name: narr_hall_trial_final
storyPoint.title: Negotiating the Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
Very well. You will both travel to the trial site aboard the *Moonhowler* but only your two meks will dismount. Failure to follow this order may result in hostilities with the defending Jade Falcon forces. I think you both know how the rest of this goes. Should Star Commander Mathius prove victorious, we are leaving a jumpship behind with a double-charged lithium battery that should allow you to catch up with our forces on Wotan.
May the best warrior win and may the ways of our people survive until we all must fall. Seyla!

storyPoint.name: narr_hall_trial_bloodname
storyPoint.title: You Have Been Nominated
storyPoint.narrative:
Greetings, {commander}. I have been chosen to serve in the role of Loremaster until a permanent replacement is found. It is therefore my duty to inform you that you have been nominated to participate in a trial of bloodright for the {bloodname} bloodname. The documents I have with me should indicate that this is a particularly prestigious bloodheritage, and thus I expect no objection to such a nomination, quiaff?
*He pauses briefly, before continuing.*
Due to shortages of manpower, we have less than the normal 32 participants for this trial. You have therefore been seeded to join the competition in the second round. You will have to win four consecutive rounds of combat to emerge as the ultimate victor.
Your first battle is scheduled for tomorrow. Each of the subsequent battles will be a day apart, allowing you some time for repair, if necessary. I will next see you at the trial, {commanderRank}. May your skill prove your worth.

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_kill_mathius
storyPoint.title: Death of a Warrior
storyPoint.narrative:
As you pull down on your firing triggers, immense energies stab from your weapons into Mathius's cockpit. Within seconds, the cockpit is turned into slag and whatever was within it has been cooked alive or atomized.
You stand for a moment in contemplation as your weapons cycle and cool. You note movement out of the corner of your eye and look up to see several Jade Falcon meks approaching. Fearing a trap, you begin cycling your weapons online before realizing that the Jade Falcons do not have weapons raised and instead their meks have formed something like a circle of equals. Slowly, they bow their heads in recognition of a warrior's life lost in the honorable combat of a trial of refusal. Then without a word, they salute your mek and withdraw.
As the salvage crews arrive to recover what is left of Mathius's mek, you return slowly to the *Moonhowler*.

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_mercy_mathius
storyPoint.title: Demand of Bondsref
storyPoint.narrative:
What!? I will never serve you and your warden ways! You may choose to live in exile, but I will die a clan warrior. I demand the right of *bondsref*!
*There is a rustling in the cabin, and then you hear a loud gunshot accompanied by a flash in Mathius's cockpit. Through the glazed glasteel, you can see his body slump over lifelessly.* *You stand for a moment in silent shock at Mathius's unexpected rashness. Then you note movement out of the corner of your eye and look up to see several Jade Falcon meks approaching. Fearing a trap, you begin cycling your weapons online before realizing that the Jade Falcons do not have weapons raised and instead their meks have formed something like a Circle of Equals. Slowly, they bow their heads in recognition of a warrior's life lost in the honorable combat of a Trial of Refusal. Then without a word, they salute your mek and withdraw.*
*As the salvage crews arrive to recover what is left of Mathius's mek, you return slowly to the Moonhowler.*

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_mathius_killed
storyPoint.title: Death of a Warrior
storyPoint.narrative:
As the battle abruptly dies out, you look at the battered remains of Mathius's mek. There is no movement from the crushed cockpit. It appears that Mathius did not survive the trial.
You stand for a moment in contemplation as your weapons cycle and cool. You note movement out of the corner of your eye and look up to see several Jade Falcon meks approaching. Fearing a trap, you begin cycling your weapons online before realizing that the Jade Falcons do not have weapons raised and instead their meks have formed something like a circle of equals. Slowly, they bow their heads in recognition of a warrior's life lost in the honorable combat of a trial of refusal. Then without a word, they salute your mek and withdraw.
As the salvage crews arrive to recover what is left of Mathius's mek, you return slowly to the *Moonhowler*.

storyPoint.name: narr_trial_exile_mathius
storyPoint.title: The Shame of Exile
storyPoint.narrative: What!? Have it your way then! I would rather serve as an astech in a true clan than with *dezgra* exiles who have forsaken the way of the clans. Mark my words, I will become an *abtakha* of the Jade Falcons and when I do I will come looking for you. You hear me? This isn't over. I will-- *You turn off your comms at this point and begin trudging back to the *Moonhowler*. Your rear camera shows you that several Jade Falcon meks that were apparently stationed as observers have begun to move forward. What they will do with Mathius, you do not know.*

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_begin
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
*Having just left the Turn-Over party in the mess, you are settling into your bunk when a message comes through from the bridge.*
{commander}, it looks like there is some kind of interpersonal conflict in the mess. I think you are going to need to check it out.
*Sighing, you get out of your bunk, straighten up your jacket, and take the lift down to the mess.*
*You arrive to see a crowd surrounding two of your MekWarriors who are standing off from one another, with hostile intent mirrored in their eyes. You see that each is holding a long combat knife.*

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_felipe
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative: I will not listen to you slander our Khans with such talk. Khan Phelan is a true Wolf having been accepted into our clan by the traditions of *abtakha*. You dishonor not only him, but our ways with your talk. I demand a trial of grievance!

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_none
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
You hear murmuring across the deck. With tensions running high since Khan Phelan's departure, it is clear that some were looking forward to a violent outlet. After giving you a hard stare, both of the belligerents sheathe their weapons and depart. The rest of the crowd then slowly dissipates.
You have resolved the conflict for the moment, but you do not know what consequences it may have for long term morale.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_knives
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
A cheer rises from the crowd. Tensions have been running high since Khan Phelan's departure, and this event promises to at least vicariously satiate their need for violence.
A Circle of Equals is quickly formed as tables are pushed to the side. The two main belligerents square off, each in a crouching position with their knife held at the ready. With a cry, they simultaneously move to the attack.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_fists
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
A cheer rises from the crowd. Tensions have been running high since Khan Phelan's departure, and this event promises to at least vicariously satiate their need for violence.
A Circle of Equals is quickly formed as tables are pushed to the side. The two main belligerents square off, each holding their fists in front and balancing delicately on the balls of their feet. With a cry, they simultaneously move to the attack.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_unaug_ella_w
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Every sibko trains extensively for these kinds of fights. With practiced ease, Felipe and Ella dance around the Circle of Equals, each attempting to bait the other into an overreach with quick jabs. The crowd shouts and jeers, encouraging them to fully let loose.
Finally, Ella decides to go for the kill. After a quick feinting movement, she lunges in and tackles Felipe around the midsection, knocking him to the floor. She quickly straddles him as he attempts to escape her grasp and begins pummeling him in the face. With her superior size, Felipe is not able to escape and after several savage strikes, his bloodied head dips to the floor.
Ella pulls back her fist to continue the assault, but is quickly pulled off of Felipe's sprawling body by her peers. She is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for calling out Khan Phelan's cowardice, while Felipe is rushed off to the medical bay.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved without loss of life. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_unaug_felipe_w
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Every sibko trains extensively for these kinds of fights. With practiced ease, Felipe and Ella dance around the Circle of Equals, each attempting to bait the other into an overreach with quick jabs. The crowd shouts and jeers, encouraging them to fully let loose.
Finally, Ella decides to go for the kill. After a quick feinting movement, she lunges in and attempts to tackle Felipe around the midsection. At the last second, Felipe recognizes the feint and with astonishing agility turns his movement into a roundhouse kick that catches Ella in the face. She falls to her knees, stunned and dazed, blood oozing from her broken nose.
Before she has a chance to recover, Felipe lunges in with a fierce upper cut that knocks Ella back into the tables ringing the Circle of Equals. Amid the clatter of tables and chairs overturning, her limp body hits the floor and does not rise.
Felipe is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for standing up for the Khan, while Ella is rushed to the medical bay.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved without loss of life. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_ella_w_begin
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Every sibko trains extensively for these kinds of fights. With practiced ease, Felipe and Ella dance around the Circle of Equals, each attempting to bait the other into an overreach with quick slashing motions, but neither is able to make contact nor lure the other into an overreach. The crowd shouts and jeers, encouraging them to fully let loose.
Seeking to break the stalemate, Felipe darts in for a quick slash, but at the last second drops low for a sweeping attack. Ella is prepared for such deception, however, and leaps over his sweeping legs. Seeing an opportunity, she brings her knife down to skewer his now exposed body, but Felipe rolls out of the way at the last second and her knife bounces off the metal flooring of the mess hall. Quickly rebounding, she spins 180 degrees and catches Felipe with her knife as he rises up and begins backpedaling out of the way. A deep red cut blooms across Felipe's abdomen, and he pauses momentarily to feel his midsection.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_ella_w_ko
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Seeing an opportunity to finish the fight, Ella brings her knife in for a vicious finishing blow. Felipe rolls out of the way of a blow that would have gutted him, but there is a loud crack as Ella catches his chin with her elbow. Felipe drops like a rock.
With a bloodcurdling cry, Ella moves into finish off her prey, but other warriors surround her and pull her back. You hear shouts of "first blood!" as the winner is declared. Ella is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for calling out Khan Phelan's cowardice, while the unconscious and bleeding Felipe is rushed off to the medical bay.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved without loss of life. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_ella_w_death
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Seeing an opportunity to finish the fight, Ella brings her knife in for a vicious finishing blow. Felipe attempts to roll out of the way, but Ella adjust the aim of her strike and brings her knife up under Felipe's chin. The blade sinks all the way into the hilt, clearly slicing directly into Felipe's brain. He drops like a load of bricks to the floor, dead.
There is a moment of stunned silence before the mess hall erupts in both cheers and groans. Despite (or perhaps because of) the lethal outcome, Ella is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for calling out Khan Phelan's cowardice, while medtechs arrive to deal with Felipe's corpse.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved, but not without a terrible price. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_felipe_w_begin
storyPoint.narrative:
Every sibko trains extensively for these kinds of fights. With practiced ease, Felipe and Ella dance around the Circle of Equals, each attempting to bait the other into an overreach with quick slashing motions, but neither is able to make contact nor lure the other into an overreach. The crowd shouts and jeers, encouraging them to fully let loose.
Seeking to break the stalemate, Felipe darts in for a quick slash, but at the last second drops low for a sweeping attack. Ella is not as quick as Felipe and is knocked flat on her back, stunned as she loses her breath. Felipe quickly jumps on top of her and brings down his knife for a killing blow. At the last second, Ella diverts the blow from its intended location, but it sinks deeply into her right shoulder.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_felipe_w_ko
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Ella screams with rage and pain and throws Felipe off of her. She gets up, grunting with pain and woozy with blood loss, while Felipe paces around her, waiting for another opportunity. Realizing she must end the fight soon if she hopes to win. Ella charges Felipe hoping to take him by surprise. Felipe is ready, however, and dodges out of the way, sticking out a foot to send Ella tumbling into the tables and chairs outside the Circle of Equals.
The crowd erupts with shouts of joy and loathing at Felipe's victory. He is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for standing up for the Khan, while Ella is rushed to the medical bay.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved without further loss of life. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_trothkin_div_aug_felipe_w_death
storyPoint.title: Trothkin Divided
storyPoint.narrative:
Ella screams with rage and pain and throws Felipe off of her. She gets up, grunting with pain and woozy with blood loss, while Felipe paces around her, waiting for another opportunity. Realizing she must end the fight soon if she hopes to win. Ella charges Felipe hoping to take him by surprise. Felipe is ready, however, and with a deft movement, throws his knife at the charging Ella. It catches her in the neck, cutting off her windpipe. She tumbles to the floor and feebly attempts to pull it out as her lifeblood gushes from her wound before going still.
There is a moment of stunned silence before the mess hall erupts in both cheers and groans. Despite (or perhaps because of) the lethal outcome, Felipe is toasted with cheers by many of the other warriors for defending Khan Phelan's honor, while medtechs arrive to deal with Ella's corpse.
It appears that the conflict has been resolved, but not without a terrible price. What other consequences may come of it, you know not.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_trap_aftermath
storyPoint.title: Trapped
storyPoint.narrative: *When your vision returns, you can see that Ulric's Gargoyle is nothing but ash and liquid metal. Quickly, Chistu turns and fires upon Vlad's Timber Wolf, knocking it back into a building. You are about to rush to his aid, when your sensors ping with multiple enemy contacts. It is an ambush!*

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_ambush_failure
storyPoint.title: The End?
storyPoint.narrative:
*You fight like Wolves, but there are simply too many enemies. As your MekWarriors fall, you sense this battle will be the end of your command and perhaps your life.*
*Finally, your own mek is brought down. As your consciousness fades into darkness, you have a dim awareness of someone pulling your body from a burning cockpit. Then all goes black.*

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_black_out
storyPoint.title: The End?
storyPoint.narrative: *As you open the mike to deliver your response, you suddenly lose your balance and start to see double. It appears that the head injury you suffered in combat was worse than you thought.* *Your body tenses as your mek topples. At the moment of impact, you feel exploding pain in your temple and the whole world fades to black.*

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_blood_trial1
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
*You step forward to meet your first opponent, a heavily muscled MekWarrior. You hear Khan Crichell behind you.*
Why are you worthy of the {bloodname} bloodname?
*The MekWarrior responds.*
I am Star Commander Marketta. I represent fourteen who are not worthy.
*The Star Commander looks at you expectantly. You tap her lightly on the shoulder. She turns to the side and kneels.*
*Because of what you have done for the Clan, none wish to stand against you for a bloodname, but tradition must still be honored. You continue through the next four warriors in the same fashion.*

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_blood_trial1_mathius
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
*You step forward to meet your first opponent, who is none other than Star Commander Mathius. You hear Khan Crichell behind you.*
Why are you worthy of the {bloodname} bloodname?
*Mathius responds.*
I am Star Commander Mathius. I represent fourteen who are not worthy.
*Mathius looks at you expectantly. You tap him lightly on the shoulder. He turns to the side and kneels.*
*Because of what you have done for the Clan, none wish to stand against you for a bloodname, but tradition must still be honored. You continue through the next four warriors in the same fashion.*

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_blood_trial2
storyPoint.title: Bloodname Trial
storyPoint.narrative:
Another of your number has been blooded. I present to you {commander}.
*Many voices rise in unison.*
Seyla!
*As you stand on the stage, You see Vlad rise and stand before Crichell. The ritual is repeated as Vlad is awarded a bloodname as well. Unlike you, he takes the opportunity to brutalize each of the warriors he defeats. Soon he stands on the stage next to you as Vladimir Ward.*
Your clan is now without a Khan. Who should lead the Wolves?

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_khan_nomination1
storyPoint.title: Who will be Khan?
storyPoint.narrative: I nominate Star Captain Vlad Ward as Khan and {commander} as saKhan.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_khan_nomination2
storyPoint.title: Who will be Khan?
storyPoint.narrative:
Vey well. Are there any other nominations.
*The hall is silent.*
All those in favor of this nomination, raise your voice.
*As one, all those in the hall exclaim "Aye."*
Then let it be recorded. I present to you Khan Vladimir Ward and saKhan {commanderName}.

storyPoint.name: narr_wotan_khan_nomination3
storyPoint.title: You Lead, but to Where?
storyPoint.narrative:
*As the crowd cheers, you look across at Vlad who has a steely look in his eyes.* *You have restored your Clan, but much is yet uncertain. Your clan is diminished and will need to rebuild its strength while others will sense its weakness. Khan Ward will likely wish to resume the march to Terra soon. Will you join or oppose him? That will be your decision to make in the years to come. For now, you will bask in the glory of all that you have accomplished.*
Seyla!

mission.name: Colmar
mission.desc: Colmar was notable as the first battlefield of the Refusal War. The main fighting occurred in the Marakaa Valley, where the 352 Wolf Assault Cluster used the dry river bed to position themselves advantageously against the defending 12th Falcon Regulars.

mission.name: Baker 3
mission.desc: The lush forests and hot springs of Baker 3's southern continent, Lowa, have made it a recreation and tourism destination in the region for centuries. Khan Kerensky planned to use those same features to her advantage to devastate the defending Jade Falcon forces. While her main forces feinted a direct assault through the heavy forests near the Jade Falcon HQ, her remaining forces would approach the rear area by traveling directly up the Baker River. Because the Baker River was fed by numerous hot springs upriver, it would help mask the heat signatures of these units. Khan Kerensky hoped that a lightning assault on these rear areas would take the fight out of the Falcons.

mission.name: Devin
mission.desc:
A jumpship sail array mishap delayed the start of the Devin campaign, suggesting ill omen for the assault. The desert planet itself was a foreboding place, raging with windstorms and electrical interference.
Khan Kerensky deployed her few remaining fresh clusters to the attack. It would prove to be a disastrous assault.

mission.name: Denizli
mission.desc: While the main Wolf forces engages the Jade Falcons elsewhere on the planet, you have been tasked with capturing an oil refinery guarded by a unique Jade Falcon Warrior named Tobias Malthus. You have bid your full forces to take the oil refinery from his forces.

mission.name: Denizli
mission.desc: While the main Wolf forces engages the Jade Falcons elsewhere on the planet, you have been tasked with capturing an oil refinery guarded by a unique Jade Falcon Warrior named Tobias Malthus. You have bid forces to take the oil refinery equal to the defending forces.

mission.name: Denizli
mission.desc: While the main Wolf forces engages the Jade Falcons elsewhere on the planet, you have been tasked with capturing an oil refinery guarded by a unique Jade Falcon Warrior named Tobias Malthus. You have agreed to face his forces in a series of single combat trials. Each trial will be fought in the arctic tundra near the target facility.

mission.name: Twycross
mission.desc: Hoping to draw the Jade Falcons into the same error that cost them Twycross during the Clan invasion, Khan Kerensky placed meks in strategic locations all throughout the Great Gash. She then organized her remaining forces on the Plain of Curtains in front of the Gash to try to lure the Jade Falcons into the kill zone.

mission.name: A Sundering of Loyalties
mission.desc: You must face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal over your decision to join the Warden Wolves in exile on Morges.

mission.name: A Sundering of Loyalties
mission.desc: You must face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal over your decision to join the Warden Wolves in exile on Morges.

mission.name: A Sundering of Loyalties
mission.desc: You must face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal over your decision to join the Warden Wolves in exile on Morges.

mission.name: A Sundering of Loyalties
mission.desc: You must face Star Commander Mathius in a Trial of Refusal over your decision to join the Warden Wolves in exile on Morges.

mission.name: Wotan
mission.desc: Surprising the Jade Falcons, Ulric leapfrogged past Butler to strike directly at Wotan, the seat of the Jade Falcon occupation zone. As his forces descended upon the capital city of Borealtown, a challenge was issued. You must now escort Ulric through the streets so that he may face off with saKhan Vandervahn Chistu in single combat.

mission.name: Morges
mission.desc: Enraged by Khan Phelan Ward's seeming retreat, the Jade Falcons sent a large force to Morges to exterminate the remaining Wolves. These forces were surprised to not only face Wolves, but a regiment of the famed Kell Hounds mercenary group. This is now a fight for survival. You must win or die.

mission.name: Bloodright Trial
mission.desc: You fight for a bloodname! If you are victorious, a new trial will appear each day until you beat all the competition.

mission.name: Trial of Refusal
mission.desc: You fight against Vandervahn Chistu to repudiate his claim to Absorb the Wolf Clan. If you win, Clan Wolf will live on.

scenario.name: Cutting Teeth
scenario.desc:
While the main body of the 12th Falcon Regulars is bottled up in Bright Basin, a trinary has broken through the main lines and is seeking to circle around and hit the Wolf forces from behind. Khan Kerensky has called in your unit to deal with the situation.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The 12th Falcon Regulars should ask for *hegira* if reduced to less than half their original force size while the player has more BV remaining. This can be simulated in MegaMek with the `/victory` command. If the player does not wish to grant *hegira*, then the bot settings for the 12th Falcon Regulars should be changed to RETREAT, and they should begin a fighting withdrawal. In either case, the player can claim control of the battlefield for *isorla*.
The player may be granted *hegira* from the Falcon forces at any point by using the `/defeat` command in MegaMek. Players granted *hegira* cannot claim control of the battlefield. They can recover downed pilots, but not meks or salvage.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy or rout 50% of the following force(s) and unit(s):
Preserve 50% or more of your own forces

scenario.name: Diversion
scenario.desc:
Your goal is to feint an attack against the Jade Falcons to get their forces to commit. You will be heavily outnumbered, so use the heavy woods to your advantage and make yourself a difficult target. To encourage their advance you must bleed their forces a little, before withdrawing with (hopefully) minimal damage.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Smelling blood, the Jade Falcon units will not grant *hegira*, nor will they ask for it. They will also not retreat. The player can only claim control of the battlefield if they destroy all opposing forces.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy or rout 10% of the following force(s) and unit(s) within 12 turns:
Preserve 60% or more of your own forces for at least 12 turns before withdrawing.

scenario.name: Hide and Seek
scenario.desc:
After wading up the river bed of the Baker River, you have pulled steaming meks out along the banks near your target. Your star has been assigned the task of taking out a nearby comm center and supply depot. Taking out any sentry units is an added bonus, but you will likely face heavy reinforcements if you remain in the field too long. So meet your objectives and get out. Fortunately, the successful feint attack by the remaining forces has left only a token garrison force and some units are currently shut down and will not immediately enter the combat.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcon units are defending a critical strategic installation and will not retreat or ask for *hegira* while either building is still functional. Once the buildings are destroyed, the Jade Falcon forces will only attempt to retreat if their remaining BV is 50% or less that of the player's forces after round 12 when all available reinforcements have arrived.

scenario.name: Hide and Seek
scenario.desc:
After wading up the river bed of the Baker River, you have pulled your steaming meks out along the banks near your target. Your star has been assigned the task of taking out a nearby comm center and supply depot. Taking out any sentry units is an added bonus, but you will likely face heavy reinforcements if you remain in the field too long. So meet your objectives and get out.
Unfortunately, the Falons have not been fooled by the feint attack by your remaining forces and so the buildings are defended by a full Nova. Additional reinforcements may arrive if you take too long to meet your objectives.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcon units are defending a critical strategic installation and will not retreat or ask for *hegira* while either building is still functional. Once the buildings are destroyed, the Jade Falcon forces will only attempt to retreat if their remaining BV is 50% or less that of the player's forces after round 14 when all available reinforcements have arrived.

scenario.name: Into the Storm
scenario.desc:
Your goal is to prevent the Jade Falcons from breaking through your lines and pursuing the remaining Wolf forces. You are heavily outnumbered, but the enemy forces are spread out and will come in waves. If you can hold out long enough, you can then retreat to your dropship. The weather on the O'Tsung Plain is hellish. A sandstorm combined with lightning strikes will make your sensors almost worthless. Visual range will be low and targeting systems will be non-optimal, limiting most combat to knife-fighting range.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Jade Falcon units will operate under forced withdrawal but will not ask for *hegira*, although they will grant it. Given the difficult situation, the player will not be able to claim battlefield salvage.

You are the bait. Your job is to do enough damage to get the falcons to chase you back through the Great Gash.
The red sands of the Plain of Curtains make for a challenging battlefield. Erratic winds can quickly rise out of nowhere and create blinding sand storms in an otherwise open terrain.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Jade Falcon units will operate under forced withdrawal but will not ask for nor grant *hegira*. The wolf forces must withdraw and will not be able to claim battlefield salvage.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy 30% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc: You have chosen to face Star Commander Mathius on the great Thompkins mega-glacier. The environment will be inhospitable and cold. Most importantly, the ice will prove difficult for piloting a mek, so be sure to watch your step.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc: You have chosen to face Star Commander Mathius in the swampy wetlands of a major river delta near the equator of Butler. The environment will make movement difficult, especially without jump jets.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc: You have chosen to face Star Commander Mathius in the vacuum of the moon of Valet orbiting Butler. It is a dangerous and unforgiving environment in which any stray hit could disable your mek through breaches into your internal system.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc: You have chosen to face Star Commander Mathius on the open plains outside the capital city of Newton. The terrain is relatively open but verdant rolling hills can sometimes block clear line of sight.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Save the Khan
scenario.desc:
SaKhan Phelan Ward is under heavy assault from Jade Falcon forces! You must combat drop behind them with everything you have to save the Khan.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcon forces should ask for *hegira* if reduced to less than half their original force size while the player has more BV remaining. This can be simulated in MegaMek with the `/victory` command. If the player does not wish to grant *hegira*, then the bot settings for the Jade Falcons should be changed to RETREAT, and they should begin a fighting withdrawal. In either case, the player can claim control of the battlefield for *isorla*.
The player will not be granted *hegira* by the Jade Falcons.

scenarioObjective.description: Defend Khan Phelan Ward:

scenario.name: Destroy the Convoy
scenario.desc:
You must destroy the supply convoy heading towards Broken Hope. To avoid detection, you will be limited to two stars of meks.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Jade Falcon forces will not retreat or ask for Hegira under any conditions, but individual units will operate under forced withdrawal conditions. They will grant hegira. Due to the nature of this strike, you will not be able to claim battlefield salvage.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy at least 75% the following force(s) and unit(s) before they exit the map:

scenario.name: Defend Ulric
scenario.desc:
You must defend Ulric from Jade Falcon attackers in an urban battlefield.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcons will not ask for or grant *hegira*. They will operate under forced withdrawal. Due to the nature of the scenario, you may not collect *isorla.*

entities.entity:
The first slot in a location is at index="1". Right Arm
Left Arm

scenarioObjective.description: The following force(s) and unit(s) must survive:
Destroy or rout 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Ambush!
scenario.desc:
The treacherous Vandervahn Chistu has murdered Ulric Kerensky! Now he is sending a wave of enemies at you to remove the evidence. You are unlikely to defeat them all, but you will fight like a Wolf.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
The Jade Falcons will not ask for or grant *hegira*. They will operate under forced withdrawal. Due to the nature of the scenario, you may not collect *isorla.*
If you fail the mission but your commander is not killed, do not check your commander as MIA in the scenario resolution.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy or rout 100% of the following force(s) and unit(s):

scenario.name: Trial of Bloodright, Round 2
scenario.desc:
Due to the small number of participants, you were seeded directly into round two.
In this round, you face a warrior named Aziza who is even older than you. Assigned to a second line mek in a garrison cluster, she nonetheless proved herself in battle upon Morges, earning a nomination for this trial.
Aziza pilots an ancient second line *Warhammer IIC* that still presents a formidable threat.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Aziza will yield the contest if her mek is crippled and your mek is not. You may surrender at any point. You cannot salvage her mek.

entities.entity: The first slot in a location is at index="1". Right Torso

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy the following units:
Preserve your own forces

scenario.name: Trial of Bloodright, Round 3
scenario.desc:
Your opponent in this round is a brash, young MekWarrior named Damien. What he lacks for in experience, he makes up for in enthusiasm. He likes speed and will be bringing a jump-capable *Shadow Cat*. Make sure you don't let him run (or jump) circles around you.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Damien will yield the contest if his mek is crippled and your mek is not. You may surrender at any point. You cannot salvage his mek.

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy the following units:
Preserve your own forces

scenario.name: Trial of Bloodright, Round 4
scenario.desc:
You have made it to the semi-finals. Your opponent in this round is Star Commander Jameel. He is an experienced MekWarrior. He will be piloting a *Summoner C*. I am sure you realize this means a heavy ultra auto-cannon in the left arm. If you let him in too close, he can end this trial very quickly.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Jameel will yield the contest if his mek is crippled and your mek is not. You may surrender at any point. You cannot salvage his mek.

entities.entity: The first slot in a location is at index="1". Left Torso

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy the following units:
Preserve your own forces

scenario.name: Trial of Bloodright, Round 5
scenario.desc:
This is it - the finals. Win today and the bloodname is yours. That will not be easy, however. Your opponent is Star Captain Olympia. She is an experienced MekWarrior and considered something of a tactical genius. She will be piloting an *Executioner* in its A configuration, which means lots of lasers.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
Having reached the finals, Olympia will not surrender until her mek is destroyed. You may surrender at any point. You cannot salvage her mek.

entities.entity: The first slot in a location is at index="1". Right Torso

scenarioObjective.description: Destroy the following units:
Preserve your own forces

scenario.name: Trial of Refusal
scenario.desc:
You can hear the roar of the crowd. Many have gathered here to watch this epic battle between yourself and saKhan Vandervahn Chistu. Among the spectators will be many who were formerly of Clan Wolf and would like nothing better than to return.
It is time to suit up and finish this.
### Hegira/Retreat Conditions
There is no surrender or hegira available in this battle. You must fight until one combatant's mek is destroyed. You cannot salvage Chistu's mek.
